description: A well-judged, well-structured wine that balances fresh, crisp and light fruit against flavors of peaches, almonds and cinnamon. It will be better in two or three years' time.
title: Volpe Pasini 2002 Zuc de Volpe Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Pinot Grigio from the Friuli Grave tends to show extra creaminess and structure in the mouth. Here is a stellar example that's backed by flavors of peach, citrus and Golden Delicious apple.
title: Vigneti Le Monde 2010 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Livelier than usual in texture and popping with bright citrus aromas and flavors, this light-bodied and barrel-fermented wine is a great palate-cleanser and will pair beautifully with dishes like raw oysters and herbed goat cheese. It smells and tastes like lemon, lime, green apple and kiwi, and has great balance.
title: Monte Volpe 2013 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino)

description: Melon and citrus aromas and flavors mingle easily in this cleanly made quaffer. It's a bit plump on the palate, yet refreshing on the lemon-lime finish.
title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Classic Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: The wine boasts a pretty golden hue and segues to tones of almond skin, stone fruit, nut and cardboard. It feels smooth and rich in the mouth and has some tart citrus flavors on the close.
title: Tenuta Luisa 2007 Rive Alte Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Estancia produces solid, savory Pinot Grigios at a fair price, and they even dropped their price last year. This one's a little off-dry, with crisp acidity and pleasant citrus, peach and honeysuckle flavors.
title: Estancia 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: La Piazza is a line of wine from Sicily's Calatrasi winery that uses fruit from various parts of Italy. This is their Pinot Grigio from northern Italy that tastes rich and creamy and is made in a New World style. Aromas revolve around butter, almond paste, peach and apricot. It doesn't have huge length, but it does taste rich and dense.
title: Calatrasi 2006 La Piazza Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This is plump and custardy in feel, but still refreshing thanks to bright apple and lime aromas and flavors. It's more citrus than apple on the crisp finish.
title: Beresford 2014 Beacon Hill Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

description: This is richer than most Pinot Grigios. It opens with aromas of toast, yellow flower, vanilla and a balsamic note while the round, full-bodied palate offers baked yellow apple, candied lemon drop, nectarine zest and almond. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy fruit while a vanilla note closes the finish. You can barely detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
title: Renato Keber 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Aromas of orchard fruit, nut and a light whiff of toast lift from the glass. The medium-bodied, straightforward palate offers pear, apple and a note of lemon drop. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean finish.
title: Colterenzio 2014 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Inviting aromas of toasted almond, pear and a whiff of chopped herb lead the nose on this linear white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine zest and flinty mineral accompanied by bright acidity.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Opens with a pretty shade of gold that denotes more sophisticated extraction and in fact that impression is carried through to the nose and mouth where the wine exhibits ripe fruity aromas, honey, almond skin, dried herbs and natural rubber. The mouthfeel is thin, but remains a step above the commercial Pinot Grigio that is so commonly available. The wine is packaged with a real vine clipping around the bottle neck.
title: Mosolo Gleni 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Here's a lean, almost colorless, citrus-driven Grigio from sunny Umbria that has a bit of candy and cola on its sweet, fragrant nose. There are peppermint renderings and dried hay in the background. It's watery and lean in the mouth and would pair with appetizers or simple vegetable dishes.
title: Lungarotti 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

description: Timing is everything with this full-bodied PG. Get at it right away and it will still be almost viscous, but it should also show ripe tropical fruit flavors, core acidity and lots of personality. Just don't let it hang around for long, especially not at room temperature.
title: Santa Julia 2007 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This Pinot Grigio is a bit more fragrant and floral in essence with aromas of stone fruit and peach blossom. It has a fresh, almost piquant edge but it also has that characteristic watery mouthfeel you'll likely encounter with this variety.
title: Ronco Blanchis 2006 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: With a honeyed edge of sweetness to the pineapple and lime flavors, this wine also has a zesty acidity that makes it finish with mouthwatering cleanness. It's easy to like, a nice late afternoon cocktail sipper, and good with baked ham or pot stickers.
title: Renwood 2006 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Aromas of green apples, peach and citrus carry over to palate. The juicy flavors are accompanied by lively acidity that makes this wine very food friendly.
title: Mezzacorona 2013 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Honey, kiwi, mango and peach come to mind and color an easy, but fragrant Grigio from the mountains of northern Italy that would pair well with exotic or Asian foods. It closes with spicy acidity and is a perfect palate cleaner.
title: Tolloy 2007 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This Pinot Grigio from northern Italy has good density and direct aromas of honey, peach and grapefruit that make for a well balanced ensemble. The wine is fresh and clean and would pair with grilled calamari or Thai mango shrimp.
title: Pighin 2006 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This delightful Pinot Grigio offers remarkable clarity and precision and generous tones of stone fruit and citrus while being creamy and rich in density. Pair it with your favorite seafood recipes.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2006 Sot Lis Rivis Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Although Pinot Grigios are white wines, you could consider this a rosé instead because of its luminous copper color. The wine boasts a thick, creamy consistency and has a generous, plush feel in the mouth. It's a special and carefully crafted wine.
title: Comelli 2006 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This is a fuller and creamier rendition of Pinot Grigio with pretty aromas of honey, peach blossom and melon that give the wine a fragrant aromatic lift. It leaves a lean but smooth impression in the mouth and ends with bright citrus flavors. Imported by MW Imports.
title: Eugenio Collavini 2007 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Most of the action is on the outside of this gaudy bottle. However, this light and slightly sweet wine has appley, floral flavors and a soft, easy texture.
title: La Catrina NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Made in a frankly commercial, off-dry style, this is dangerously quaffable. Pronounced apple, pear and melon flavors are balanced by moderate acidity and a hint of ginger on the finish. Drink now.
title: Brancott 2015 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

description: Soft and sweet, with canned apricot and syrupy peach flavors.
title: Jenica Peak 2006 Coastal Series Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Unexpectedly thick and mouthfilling, with generous peach aromas and flavors underscored by mustard greens and citrus. Clean and refreshing on the finish. Best Buy.
title: Geretto 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: An open-knit, friendly nose features lots of nectarine and ripe apple scents. Medium-weight, with plenty of stone fruit on the palate, it finishes with a cleansing burst of peppery spice. Try as an apéritif.
title: Bortoluzzi 2001 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: This luscious, balanced Pinot Grigio isn't overly complex, but scores for its cactus pear and toasted almond aromas and flavors and its peppery, refreshing finish. It's medium-bodied, with just a hint of unreleased CO2 to enliven it.
title: Masottina 2001 Vigneto Ai Palazzi Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Pineapple, citrus blossom, and white peach aromas prepare your palate for tastes of green apple, lemon zest and apricots. The finish is crisp and acidic.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: Another fine effort in a continuing series of outstanding PGs from Hogue. This is tart and stylish, loaded with citrus and bracingly acidic. Flavors meld lemon, lime, lemon verbena, orange peel and a slice of pear.
title: Hogue 2009 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The nose isn't very expressive but you can detect whiffs of adhesive bandage, medicinal herb, apple skin and mineral that carry over to the diluted, rather bitter palate. Brisk acidity underscores the wine's lean character.
title: Lechthaler 2014 Drago Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This seems to be an attempt at an Italianate style, with modest alcohol levels (11%) and the accompanying lack of fruit expression. It's largely neutral, with hints of underripe pear and white pepper that combine with chalky notes on the finish.
title: Jacob's Creek 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: This opens with aromas of hay, pressed yellow flower and orchard fruit. The direct palate offers yellow apple skin, toasted nut and a mineral note alongside invigorating acidity.
title: Poggiobello 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Gold with copper hues, this opens with aromas of wildflower, tangerine zest and a whiff of crushed stone. The vibrant palate offers rennet apple, lime, ginger drop and a hint of mineral alongside mouthwatering acidity.
title: Primosic 2014 Santa Lucia Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Fresh and fruity, this lively white offers aromas and flavors of green Anjou pear, Granny Smith apple and white peach. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp, tangy finish.
title: La Vis 2014 Ritratti Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: The nose of this lively white is a combination of delicate aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit while the bright palate offers tart Granny Smith apple, tangerine and a hint of crushed stone. Vibrant acidity carries through to the crisp finish.
title: Nals Margreid 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Delicate but alluring scents of spring flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The palate is linear and rather lean but still refreshing, offering pear, yellow apple and mineral alongside bracing acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
title: St. Pauls 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fresh and lively, this opens with aromas of jasmine, tropical fruit and a whiff of flint. The vibrant palate offers crunchy Granny Smith and candied lemon alongside brisk acidity. A mineral note energizes the crisp finish.
title: Tenuta di Angoris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Overtly sweet, with a white sugar edge to the citrus fruits, this is basically a dessert wine. Earns extra credit for cleanness and crisp acidity.
title: Robert Mondavi 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas of exotic fruit and fragrant white flower lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers tart green apple and juicy citrus alongside lively acidity.
title: Cantina di Bertiolo 2014 Villa Marchesi Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: On the sugary side, with sweetened pineapple, green apple and peach flavors that are brightened with crisp acidity. If you like your white wines on the sweet side, this is a good price.
title: Bella Ragazza 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: There's a chalky, almost sweet element to the mouthfeel that recalls Pez candy or lemon soda. The fruit aromas are bright, intense and make up for the streamlined mouthfeel.
title: Castelfeder 2010 15er Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fresh, informal and fun (in a screwcap bottle), this organically farmed Pinot Grigio delivers bright aromas of cut grass, exotic fruit and citrus. It's an easy wine with a carefree attitude.
title: TerrAmore 2010 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Simple, clean and fresh, this no-fuss Pinot Grigio would pair nicely against Chinese take-out or an outdoor salad lunch. It shows clean aromas of citrus and white peach.
title: Montresor 2010 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: A fine unoaked Pinot Grigio that shows the crispness, delicate body and richness you want in this variety. The citrus, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors could be drier, but lots of people will enjoy that edge of sugar.
title: Pietra Santa 2007 Amore Pinot Grigio (Cienega Valley)

description: Pinot Grigios like this helped make the variety one of America's most popular wines. While it's basically dry and crisp in acidity, it offers jammy green apple, lemon and lime Lifesaver candy and vanilla notes that appeal to consumers.
title: Robert Mondavi 2012 Private Selection Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: This pretty Pinot Grigio opens with creamy aromas of melon, stone fruit and pear. It has a full, generous and persistent personality.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Creamy aromas of vanilla cookies and melon lead to a plump palate with just enough vital acidity to keep things fresh. Citrusy flavors lean toward clementines and grapefruit, while the finish is peachy but  also pithy in flavor.
title: Alma Andina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Ecco Domani delivers consistent, easy-drinking wines that work well on informal occasions, but don't necessarily offer personality or territorial typicity. But we don't always want intellectual wines. If you are hankering for bright citrus and peach with mouth-cleansing acidity, this is a great choice.
title: Ecco Domani 2011 Collezione Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This medium-bodied wine has very subtle aromas and flavors, a fairly smooth texture, and an ever-so-slightly buttery accent. It offers a slim personality to enjoy.
title: Insomnia 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Pineapple, banana, peach and apricot are followed by a dusty mineral quality that adds extra dimension. This is a tasty, fruit-forward wine that closes with tingling, spicy crispness.
title: Masottina 2005 Ai Palazzi Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Structured and elegant, this lovely Pinot Grigio opens with delicate scents of white Alpine flower, citrus and a whiff of herb. The bright palate offers creamy white peach, crisp green apple and juicy nectarine while a mineral note backs up the finish. Bright acidity provides lift and balance.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

description: This is a challenging wine, but it takes bravery to make Pinot Grigio like a red wine, using amphorae and terra cotta along the way. It's pink, but not a rose. Zesty aromas of tangerine, wet stone and grapefruit skins also show a bit of yeast. There is strong kumquat tang to the sip, which is fairly sour without the ripeness one might expect from the color.
title: Giornata 2015 Ramato Quattro Bassi Ranch Vineyard Pinot Grigio (San Luis Obispo)

description: Initial grassy aromas of hay and wheat usher in scents of peach, melon and saline water. This is a bit pulpy on the palate, but with cutting acidity. Melon, apple cider and nectarine flavors finish with friendly but nondescript white-fruit flavors.
title: François Lurton 2014 Santa Celina Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This fragrant white opens with aromas of white spring flower, jasmine, citrus, pear and a hint of alpine herb. The vibrant, elegant palate delivers layers of creamy Granny Smith apple, nectarine zest and steely mineral balanced by bright acidity.
title: Elena Walch 2013 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Another clean and tasty bottling from this label's numbered series, this shows light nectarine and lemon aromas on the nose. The texture is grippy and bright in acidity, offering crunchy Asian pear flavors that prove quite refreshing, with decent length.
title: Noble Vines 2016 152 Pinot Grigio (San Bernabe)

description: This blend of 75% Pinot Grigio and 15% Vermentino is a light, simple quaff with some snap to it and not much on the finish.
title: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: A pink-meets-tan color is the greeting on this peachy Pinot Grigio that smells like fresh applesauce. A spunky palate of stone fruit and moderate acidity deals additional notes of waxy melon.
title: Sierra Batuco 2015 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Maule Valley)

description: White flower, orchard fruit and citrus aromas emerge on this lively white. The bright, crisp palate delivers crunchy rennet apple and lime zest alongside racy acidity that leaves a clean finish.
title: Cantina Cortaccia 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This opens with delicate aromas of white peach, vanilla and toasted oak that carry over to the palate along with candied lemon drop and apple. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.
title: Mezzacorona 2014 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Heady aromas of yellow stone fruit, grapefruit and a touch of light baking spice lead the way. The full-bodied palate shows apricot, yellow peach, mineral and a hint of nutmeg alongside lively acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
title: Mezzacorona 2015 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Vibrant and crisp, this offers delicate aromas of acacia flower and citrus. The bright, linear palate shows crunchy green apple, tangerine zest and a hint of white almond alongside racy acidity.
title: Kris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Apple, melon and a touch of vanilla give a tasty spectrum of aromas and flavors to this medium-bodied wine. It's light enough to sip easily but has a bit of depth to the flavors that makes it interesting.
title: Belle Ambiance 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: One of Friuli Venezia Giulia's little known denominations, the Carso growing zone, with its rocky soil, is turning out some fine whites like this elegant Pinot Grigio. Round, creamy but also loaded with finesse, it delivers aromas and flavors of ripe pear, creamy apple and juicy lemon while a stony mineral note graces the finish.
title: Castelvecchio 2015 Pinot Grigio

description: Made in the sweet, sugary style that many consumers like, this is almost like an off-dry dessert wine. Tastes like a citrus and peach power drink, with alcohol.
title: Montevina 2006 Pinot Grigio (Amador County)

description: Light and lean pear fruit, with subtle lime notes and a hint of sweetness appearing on the finish.
title: San Giuseppe 2002 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Shows the ill effects of age on this style of wine already. The vibrant, fresh fruit is fading, being replaced by some dusty spice notes.
title: Santi 2001 Sortesele Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: A deep gold color sends up warning flags, and the flavors bear that out. Has simple apple flavors with a touch of shellac and no depth. Kosher.
title: Bartenura 2000 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: This low-alcohol offering exhibits less weight and richness as a result. Still, it's a pleasant, lean white that relies on lemony flavors to provide crisp refreshment.
title: Brancott 2014 Flight Song Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

description: Here's a polished Pinot Grigio with character. It's loaded with creamy green apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine sensations accented with spicy notes of cinnamon and ginger that add depth. Crisp acidity generates freshness and it has a lingering finish.
title: Gradis'ciutta 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This structured Pinot Grigio shows the true potential of this popular grape. It opens with fragrances of pear, mineral, smoke and aromatic herbs. These carry over to the creamy palate, alongside juicy apple, white peach, lemon zest, pastry filling and clove. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh and balanced.
title: Russiz Superiore 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Minerally and neutral on the nose, this tastes fresh and crisp like a green apple, with dry flavors of white fruit and bitter almond. It retains that almond character on the finish, which turns even drier and more bitter.
title: Arauco 2011 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Central Valley)

description: This is a thin, tart wine, with simple apricot, citrus, honey and peach flavors that finish sour and dry.
title: Castle Rock 2011 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

description: Aromas of bees wax and clover honey come with some volatility. The palate tastes a touch bitter and high pitched, and the acidity feels flat. A note of honey-infused breakfast tea surfaces on the palate.
title: Doukénie 2011 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)

description: Just a touch of oak adds a welcome creamy smokiness to this dry, crisply acidic wine. It's superrich in ripe lychee, Mandarin orange, sweet lime and spice flavors. Refreshing and clean, it's a nice cocktail sipper.
title: Benessere 2009 Pinot Grigio (Carneros)

description: White spring flower and apple aromas lead the way on this enjoyable white. The soft fresh palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, citrus and a hint of mineral that lifts the finish.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Cavit's Bottega Vinaia line offers an extremely likeable and creamy wine that will more than satisfy adoring fans of Italian Pinot Grigio. The layered aromas are both opulent and pristine and recall acacia flower, yellow fruit, butterscotch and honey—loads of honey. In the mouth, it is lean and fresh with perky spice on the finish.
title: Bottega Vinaia 2006 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This 100% Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of lemon, green apple and white peach that carry over to the juicy palate along with an almond note. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Light aromas of pear, white flowers and melon lead to dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It doesn't bring much complexity but still offers plenty of appeal.
title: Anew 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Slightly herbal aromas and vivid citrus flavors lend a unique personality to this light-bodied wine. A whiff of just-chopped parsley precedes bright lemon-lime flavors and definite acidity that will help it pair smashingly with all kinds of seafood, salads and light pastas.
title: Gnarly Head 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Straightforward and enjoyable, it delivers aromas of peach blossom and citrus. The juicy palate offers white peach, green apple and banana peel. Sip this as an apéritif or pair with light first courses.
title: Cormòns 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This substantial wine is replete with apricot and a faint lurking of herb. The acidity is there, just faintly, racing through to the finish.
title: Las Positas 2012 Buttner Sunol Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

description: Smooth and appealing, with ample fresh citrus flavors and a supple mouthfeel, this isn't so assertive that it gets in the way of the conversation or the food. Sourcing good quality grapes from non-premier regions keeps the price down.
title: Cookies & Cream 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Everything about this wine is admirable except for the concentration. It's dry and crisp with acidity, but only delicately flavored with citrus, pears, honey and vanilla bean.
title: Seven Daughters NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: There's a honeyed, mead-like character on the nose of this Steve Clifton wine. It also shows buttered brioche, lemon curds and an underlying white rock minerality. Ruby-red grapefruit flesh and ripe nectarine flavors arrive once sipped, and a chalky grip ensues, making for a very dynamic and intriguing wine.
title: Palmina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: This rosé gets its pretty eye-of-the-partridge color from having undergone cold soaking. Dry, soft and subtle, it shows peach, vanilla and spice flavors. Great with cioppino or grilled salmon.
title: Morovino 2011 Avila Beach Sunset Dry Rosé of Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Subdued aromas of red apple and melon are followed by a dry, medium-bodied palate with a tart, drawn-out finish.
title: Hogue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This light-bodied wine brings enjoyment at a very low price. Attractive grapefruit and dried herb aromas followed by citrus and savory flavors make it appetizing and enjoyable. It tastes dry, fairly crisp and well balanced.
title: CK Mondavi 2014 Willow Springs Pinot Grigio (California)

description: An assertive and substantive wine, this has very peachy aromas, vivid and ripe peach and apple flavors, and a texture that's energized by good acidity. It is light to medium bodied and nearly dry.
title: Murphy-Goode 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The fruit that was used to make this Pinot Grigio was sourced from a High Valley vineyard situated at an elevation of 2,000 feet. The resulting wine is full of citrus and green apple aromas and flavors. The finish shows a touch of sweetness.
title: Ramspeck 2011 Sassolini Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

description: Delicate alluring scents suggesting ripe orchard fruit and Spanish broom lead the nose on this subtle elegant white. On the bright balanced palate, notes of beeswax and mineral underscore Bartlett pear and yellow apple. It boasts impressive harmony and freshness for what was an extremely hot vintage.
title: Borgo Conventi 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Pretty fragrances of white spring flowers and pears lead to a lively palate that offers white peach and green apple alongside bright acidity. It finishes clean and crisp.
title: Tolloy 2013 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Pretty fragrances recall white spring flowers and white fruit. The bright palate offers juicy Granny Smith, yellow peaches and citrus alongside crisp acidity that leaves a clean, dry finish.
title: Kris 2013 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fresh and approachable, this is a light, flowery expression of the variety, sourced from the Russian River no less, that's dry and flavored in fennel, apricot and apple. Medium in terms of weight and body, it finishes refreshingly.
title: Terlato 2013 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: As sweet as a dessert wine. Tastes like sugared pineapple, apricot and orange juice. Fine in cleansing acidity, but it's not really a dry table wine.
title: Carmenet 2009 Vintner's Collection Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: An easygoing, casual wine with melon and marshmallow flavors and a soft texture. It's cleanly made, light on the palate and almost sweet going down.
title: Insomnia 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: There's little if any oak on this dry Pinot Grigio, leaving the lemon, lime, peach and mineral flavors to star. It's an easy wine to drink, and with crisp acidity, stimulates the palate as a cocktail sipper.
title: Mosby 2010 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: A bit heavy for Pinot Grigio, with soft, fruit juice flavors of oranges, peaches and mangoes.
title: Arrow Creek 2010 Coastal Series Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This refreshing Pinot Grigio opens with delicate aromas of white spring flower and pear. The easygoing palate offers green apple and lemon-lime alongside zesty acidity.
title: La Vis 2013 Simboli Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This bright Pinot Grigio delivers juicy pineapple and citrus sensations. It's simple and fresh with zesty acidity.
title: Pighin 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Blended with 15% Riesling and fermented and aged in stainless steel, it's lightly aromatic with notes of stone fruit and macerated grape skins. It drinks off-dry with the flavor concentration a bit wanting.
title: Gecko 2012 Pinot Grigio (Snipes Mountain)

description: You'll find lots of ripe orange, pineapple, lemon and honeysuckle flavors in this crisp, acidic Pinot Grigio. It finishes with a hint of maple syrup.
title: Bianchi 2012 Los Alamos Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a light, steely white with more honeysuckle and floral characteristics than fruit. It's light in alcohol and texture, and especially good for the wine drinker looking for something subtle.
title: The White Knight 2012 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Pinot Grigio has yet to find a distinguishing style in Washington State. This is borderline generic, almost beery, a plain, pleasant, fairly neutral white wine with a mix of white peaches and green apples.
title: Columbia Crest 2008 Grand Estates Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Sweetly fragrant, with hints of pear and melon. The palate is wet, lean and acidic, which helps push the lychee and melon flavors. A clean, light, mild refresher with sharper-than-expected acids. Nothing more than that.
title: Callia 2008 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: Light, tropical but ultimately dilute, with chalky, drying, tart flavors that run toward lemon and underripe pineapple. Lemony on the finish and monotone.
title: Funky Llama 2009 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon grass and grapefruit pith that pave the way for delightful flavors of Honey Crisp apples and red grapefruit juice.
title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Grigio (Thracian Valley)

description: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors, dipping a bit in the middle before coming back together.
title: Wind Rose 2015 Dry White Wine Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

description: Surprisingly silky on the palate, this approachable but elegant Pinot Grigio is a great value. Its punchy tangerine and lemon flavors are crisp and widely appealing, but there's also a nuanced slick of minerality on the midpalate. Drink now through 2019.
title: Starling Castle 2015 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)

description: Overtly sweet, like orange tea with a couple spoons of white sugar.
title: Backhouse 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Pressed hawthorn, mature orchard fruit and a whiff of aromatic herb lead the nose. Round and savory, the full-bodied palate offers creamy yellow apple, juicy pear and a hint of crystallized ginger. It's balanced, with just enough freshness and a lingering finish.
title: Borgo San Daniele 2015 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: White spring blossom and citrus aromas waft out of the glass. On the palate, crisp acidity brightens creamy apple, pear and tangerine zest. It's quite simply crisp and delicious.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2016 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: An easy Pinot Grigio to like for its smoothness and slightly sweet orange peel, white pepper, vanilla and honey flavors. Good everyday price, and in wide distribution.
title: CK Mondavi 2012 Willow Springs Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's a fun and easy-drinking Pinot Grigio (in a screw cap bottle) that delivers bright citrus, melon and dried hay. The mouthfeel is very simple with a smooth, waxy feel and a slightly sweet endnote.
title: Domenico Cavazza 2012 Classic Line Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Easy and fresh, you could pair this Italian white with freshwater fish or grilled shrimp. It delivers one-dimensional tones of citrus, peach and melon.
title: Canti 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: A nice wine in a box, and at the equivalent of about five bucks a bottle, a value. Crisp in acidity and clean, it has flavors of oranges, limes and apricots. A little too sweet, but at this price, who's counting?
title: Bota Box 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A sound, everyday Pinot Grigio, with good citrus and spice flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. Gets the nod for simple richness.
title: Glen Ellen 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Lusciously textured and bursting with citrusy acidity, this combines savory tones of burnt sugar and apple cider with hints of fresh orange peel and white flower. Crushed stone and a tea leaf astringency linger on the finish.
title: Channing Daughters 2010 Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

description: Light fresh aromas and flavors along with decent balance make this wine a versatile drink. The flavors are faint but clean, so it makes a good palate cleanser and should work well for a crowd.
title: Beringer 2016 Founders' Estate Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A simple, easy wine to drink, crisp and slightly sweet in orange, lime, peach and pear flavors.
title: Big House 2010 The Birdman Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Shows the bright, zesty acidity and citrus and floral flavors that characterize this variety. The alcohol is refreshingly low, only 13%, but the wine is thoroughly dry. Very nice for an aperitif sipper, with shellfish, or with goat cheese and roasted peppers on toasted sourdough.
title: Tamás Estates 2006 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: This structured wine opens with aromas of green apple, pear, clove and a hint of nutmeg that all carry over to the palate along with a mineral note. The creamy texture has nice weight and is brightened by vibrant acidity. Oliver McCrum, T. Edward Wines.
title: Erste Neue 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Delicate on the attack, with gentle orange blossom and honeyed lemon flavors, this mineral-driven Pinot Grigio builds in intensity and tangerine fruitiness on the palate. It finishes crisp, with tonic lime pith and herb notes.
title: Sivi 2011 Pinot Populus Pinot Grigio (Vipavska Dolina)

description: Here's a pretty, easy-drinking wine that reveals aromas of Granny Smith apple, hay and hints of exotic fruit that carry over to the palate. The ripe fruit is brightened by fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
title: Franz Haas 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: A medium-bodied wine, it delivers sensations of Alpine wild flowers and Granny Smith apple. The round palate is brightened by fresh acidity but you'll also feel the warmth of evident alcohol.
title: Girlan 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Subdued aromas include white spring flowers, pear and apple. The palate delivers green apple along with a hint of lemon peel and almond. You'll notice the warmth of alcohol on the close.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This copper-colored Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of green apples and whiffs of tropical fruit. The slightly sweet palate offers juicy pink grapefruit, ripe pear and peach alongside crisp acidity.
title: Casata Monfort 2013 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Steve Clifton takes this common grape on an uncommonly tasty spin, starting with taut and fresh aromas of green-apple flesh, grapefruit pith and light white flowers. The earthy palate shows river-stone and wet-cement minerality but also Key lime and Gravenstein apple warmth, all wrapped up in a compelling texture.
title: Palmina 2015 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and a hint of almond while the bright, fruity palate offers green apple and peach. It's simple but well made.
title: Anterra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Lightly scented, this straightforward, easygoing wine offers delicate apple and citrus sensations. It's lean but refreshing, with a racy acidity that gives it a crisp, clean finish.
title: Castel Firmian 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: You'll find light scents of apple, pear and a dose of wet rock on this brisk white that carry over to the rather raw palate. Racy acidity gives it a nervy edge.
title: Castelfeder 2014 15 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This opens with aromas of citrus and white flower while the palate offers unripe apple, lime and a bitter almond note. It's on the lean side, with bracing acidity.
title: Isidoro Polencic 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This opens with hushed aromas of white orchard fruit and spring wildflower. The racy palate shows unripe green pear and a hint of lime alongside vibrant acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
title: Girlan 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Here's a fun and zingy white that offers aromas and flavors of white spring flower, tart green apple and a hint of mineral. It's simple but well made, with zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.
title: Mezzacorona 2014 Castel Pietra Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Sweetness, softness and a little carbonation make this drink more like a Moscato. It would make a good dessert wine or accompaniment to cheese, and will be especially good for your non wine-geek friends. Light in alcohol, too.
title: Sequin 2013 Delicately Bubbled Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Give credit to cool Monterey for yielding a wine that's this dry, with acidic long hangtime fruit. It's this type of PG that has made the variety an overnight success. The acids perk up the palate, making the pineapple, peach, fig and wildflower flavors bright and tangy.
title: Maddalena 2006 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: The appellation is in San Benito County, a terroir that has plenty of coastal influence. Acidity and ripeness are the stars in this bright, expressive, dry but fruity wine, with pineapple, lime and honeysuckle flavors. Try as an interesting alternative to Sauvignon Blanc or Viognier.
title: Pietra Santa 2006 Amore Pinot Grigio (Cienega Valley)

description: Lis Neris is a quality-minded producer in northeast Italy with a thick portfolio of delicious white wines. Among them is this crisp Pinot Grigio with immediate aromas of exotic fruit, peach and nectarine. The wine's creamy density makes it an excellent companion to pasta or rice salad.
title: Lis Neris 2006 Gris Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Fresh, creamy and tightly packed with stone fruit and melon, this lively Pinot Grigio would pair with appetizers or seafood. It boasts a soft, smooth finish with a touch of citrus acidity at the end.
title: Cantarutti 2010 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: It's very clean and fresh in aroma, cool and clear in flavor and soft in texture. Vaguely pearlike aromas lead to more vivid and interesting canteloupe flavors on the finish.
title: Bota Box 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Instead of the characteristic citrus and stone fruit aromas you usually associate with a PG, this Italian white offers mature aromas of apricot, melon and even a spot of white peppercorn. It has a perky personality and ends with a crisp note of spice.
title: Vigneti Fantinel 2006 Borgo Tesis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This is a delicate and feminine copper-colored Pinot Grigio made by Francesco and Fulvio Zorzettig that boasts finely tuned aromas of white rose, peach and exotic fruit. It offers zesty acidity and a crisp, cleansing close.
title: Zorzettig 2007 Ronchi di Pietro Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: There are soapy, grassy elements to the bouquet of this easy Grigio that help shape its perky, cheerful personality. The mouthfeel is clean and simple but the wine does a great job of keeping your palate clean.
title: Cantina San Martino 2007 Angelo Pittaro Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Partly fermented in oak casks, this full-bodied Pinot Grigio opens with floral aromas of Spanish broom, white spring flowers, vanilla and apple. The palate offers pear, apple, lemon zest and a note of bread crust alongside bright acidity.
title: Marco Felluga 2011 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Lovely golden color highlights a balanced, floral and pretty late-harvest expression of apricot jam in this nuanced wine, which is relatively low in alcohol with 12.3% residual sugar. It offers viscosity that doesn't overpower, making it ideal for pairing with hard pungent cheeses or vanilla ice cream.
title: Luna 2015 Mille Baci Estate Late Harvest Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Peach and honeysuckle aromas lead the way on this lively wine and carry over to the straightforward palate along with citrusy notes. It's simple but well made.
title: Chloe 2014 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Here's a fresh and crisp Pinot Grigio that offers many more layers of intensity and personality than your standard, supermarket-bought Grigio. It shows creamy layers of silky, ripe fruit.
title: Colutta 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Lungarotti's bright Pinot Grigio from Umbria offers sunny aromas of peach, orange peel and honeysuckle. There are mature fruit notes here with sweet overtones that would work with appetizers or light meals.
title: Lungarotti 2008 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

description: A light rosé color and assertive fruit flavors help this full-bodied wine stand out. It lights up with watermelon and peach notes and has a crisp balance and firm texture from being fermented with the skins, in the same way that red wines are made.
title: Longevity 2014 Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

description: This is a fascinating expression of Pinot Grigio from Rive Alte that opens new windows onto the popular wine. The bouquet is sophisticated and bright with peach, crushed white pepper, exotic fruit and white rose. In the mouth, the wine feels creamy and rich.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2011 Sot Lis Rivis Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Located in the cool, mountainous region of Alto Adige in the far north of Italy, Cantina Terlano boasts one of Italy's finest lines of crisp white wines. Albeit more informal, this luminous and fresh Pinot Grigio offers pristine aromas of stone fruit and citrus.
title: Cantina Terlano 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Pinot Grigio, also known as Ruländer in the bilingual German-Italian region of Alto Adige, shows fragrant notes of honeysuckle and cantaloupe melon here. The wine is pristine, tonic and very refreshing in the mouth. Nicely done.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2009 Dolomiti Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is a dry, relatively austere wine. It showcases aromas of wet stone and lemon thyme, followed by flavors of pineapple and lemon and a long, citrusy finish. Drink now.
title: Redbank 2015 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: Some richness and heft separate this wine from the pack, as it carries ripe white cherry and peach flavors on its soft but just-crisp-enough texture. Its medium to full body gives it a mouth-filling presence.
title: Montevina 2015 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Fresh apple and pear aromas are accented with notes of white flowers on this delicate Pinot Grigio. It's bristling with lemon-lime acidity, but pleasantly concentrated citrus flavors, and just a hint of reeds on the finish.
title: Damiani 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: Brassfield is establishing a fine track record with this wine. It's wonderfully crisp and clean in acidity, with pure flavors of citrus fruits, lemongrass, apricots, wildflowers and white pepper. Fine as an aperitif sipper, or with almost anything that wants a dry, zesty white.
title: Brassfield 2006 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Grigio (High Valley)

description: This bottling is easy, light and crisp, starting with squeezed orange and ripe yellow apples on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with citrus and stone-fruit flavors, just right for an afternoon sip in the sun.
title: Maddalena 2015 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: Smoothness and subtlety come with a texture just rich enough to be interesting, without damping down the acidity that makes this light-bodied wine refreshing. It offers flavors of crisp green apple and a touch of pear.
title: Mirassou 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This vibrant Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of white flowers and white tree fruit. The round palate offers mature pear and green apple alongside bright acidity but the structure doesn't fully support the evident alcohol.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: If you like a little sugary sweetness in your white wines, this is a good one. It's crisp in acidity and very clean, with pie-filling flavors of pineapples, apricots, green apples, vanilla and honeysuckles.
title: Brassfield 2007 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Grigio (High Valley)

description: Subdued aromas of yellow flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of nut lift out of the glass. The palate seems rather evolved, offering suggestions dried citrus zest and a hint of baked yellow apple. It closes on a bitter almond note.
title: La Boatina 2015 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: This bottling's extreme grapefruit pithiness meets with rainy cement and a touch of rubber on the nose. The flavors are quite reductive, with tar and sour crab apple touches.
title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This ripe yet varietally true style features scents of baked pear, ripe melon, cinnamon and allspice. This is plump but lacking true depth, finishing short.
title: Vinaceous 2014 Sirenya Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

description: This medium-bodied wine doesn't show much of the variety's mouthfeel, but does show clean, dry flavors of melon and citrus. Enjoy it now through the end of 2016.
title: Evans & Tate 2015 Breathing Space Pinot Grigio (Australia)

description: A very nice everyday wine, bone dry and savory in acidity. Shows polished flavors of lemongrass, vanilla, cinnamon pepper and wildflowers. Puts everything else at this price to shame.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards NV Twin Valley Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Floral tones and aromas of ripe peach emerge from the nose of this luminous Pinot Grigio. This easy wine washes clean over the palate and leaves a fresh trail of citrus and passion fruit.
title: Lechthaler 2007 Drago Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Dry, crisp and clean, this has rich flavors of citrus, honeydew, green apple and vanilla, brightened with keen acidity. This should be relatively easy to find.
title: Geyser Peak 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This estate-grown Pinot Grigio takes the variety's basic citrus, straw, green apple and tropical fruit flavors and lifts them with partial barrel fermentation. It's a rich, but balanced, wine for drinking with almost anything.
title: HKG 2012 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is so dry, sharp, and tart, it's like lemon juice. Some will like it, while others more used to ripe, sweet fruit may find it sour. One thing is for sure, it could use some food. One of those wines that's great with shellfish.
title: Pepi 2000 Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine shows Pinot Grigio's bright, ripe lemongrass and peach flavors, touched with a kiss of honey. But it's balanced and crisp in acidity.
title: Black Stallion 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Lightly perfumed with hawthorn flower and orchard fruit aromas, this linear white offers flavors of green apple, lime and tangerine zest. Crisp acidity supports the palate while a mineral note closes the tangy finish.
title: Erste Neue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: White blossoms and fresh green herbs perfume this full-bodied wine. Dry in style and refreshingly tart, it finishes briskly with a bit of floral flair.
title: Suhru 2015 Pinot Grigio (New York)

description: Ripe honeydew melon and grapefruit flavors are edged with lime acidity in this sunny, dry wine. It's refreshing and crisp, with a hint of dusty mineral on the finish.
title: Thousand Islands Winery 2015 Pinot Grigio (New York)

description: Here's a pristine and crystalline Pinot Grigio with fresh tones of almond skin, orange zest, lemon drop and white mineral. The wine is sharp and slightly tart in the mouth and those zesty qualities would work well with vegetables au gratin or fried mozzarella sticks.
title: Luna Nuda 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Executed in a ramato style (with a copperish color), this oak-aged Pinot Grigio offers aromas of white cherry and cranberry followed by rose and candied lemon. Crisp acidity helps break apart the wine's creamy texture.
title: Bonotto delle Tezze 2009 Montesanto Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: From the northern-most, mountainous region of Italy, this cool-climate Pinot Grigio delivers pristine aromas of citrus, stone fruit, kiwi and white flower. It shows lively, zesty tones in the mouth with a touch of crisp acidity on the close.
title: Colterenzio 2010 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This lovely, cool-climate Pinot Grigio would pair with tuna carpaccio or sushi. It's a balanced and crisp wine with layers of citrus, stone fruit and honey.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2010 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Part of a trio of Best Buy wines from this producer in 2010, this easy Pinot Grigio delivers the goods in a cheerful, no-fuss package. Crisp lemon is backed by peach and pear.
title: Di Lenardo 2010 Vigneto Vigne dai Vieris Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: The fruit that was used to make this Pinot Grigio was sourced from a High Valley vineyard situated at an elevation of 2,000 feet. The resulting wine is full of citrus and green apple aromas and flavors. The finish shows a touch of sweetness.
title: Ramspeck 2011 Sassolini Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

description: Here's a pretty Pinot Grigio with broad aromas of peach, melon, cut grass and Golden Delicious apple. The wine boasts a luminous, light color and offers drying chalky tones and bright acidity in the mouth.
title: Moletto 2008 Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Pretty fragrances include white flowers and green apple. The fresh, linear palate offers pear and Granny Smith apple with a hint of lemon zest. Pair with light pasta dishes or sip as an apéritif.
title: Lechthaler 2012 Torrediluna Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

description: Livio Felluga produces one of Italy's best Pinot Grigios and this terrific vintage is no exception. The wine has a slight copper hue to its color and delivers a full, creamy style with an emphasis on soft peach and honey.
title: Livio Felluga 2006 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: There's a buttery, creamy banana feeling to this Grigio that gives the wine dimension and personality. A creamy consistency characterizes its texture and the wine achieves a wonderful balance between pulp and acidity.
title: Mezzacorona 2006 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Lots of fresh apple and tangy white peach flavor make this light-bodied wine attractive and appetizing. The flavors have great focus, the balance is bright and the alcohol is low.
title: McManis 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a light-bodied wine, with mild fruity aromas and lean, herbaceous flavors. It's straightforward, low in alcohol and refreshing.
title: McManis 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This sun soaked-Pinot Grigio from Umbria in central Italy focuses on ripe aromas of peach and pink grapefruit. It's a crisp, luminous white wine packaged in a very modern and attractive transparent bottle.
title: Lungarotti 2009 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

description: Here's a fun sparkler made from Pinot Grigio that offers a delicate floral fragrance of white spring flowers and hints of tropical fruit. It has a quenching palate , with green apple and tangerine flavors along with a crisp, clean finish.
title: Piera Martellozzo 2012 075 Carati Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Very rich, one of the more exotic Pinot Grigios on the market. Shows the variety's crispness and citrus, pear, floral, and spice flavors, with the honeyed creaminess of a barrel-fermented Chardonnay.
title: Terlato 2008 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: Intense notes of saffron and pollen lend spice to pretty blossom aromas on this fragrant Pinot Grigio. Flavors of pressed apples on the palate seem savory and subdued by comparison, but lemon-lime acidity brightens the finish.
title: Seneca Shore NV Amulet Pinot Grigio (Seneca Lake)

description: Made using organically farmed fruit, this fresh value white opens with bright tones of citrus and green apple. Pair this wine with grilled vegetables or curry chicken salad.
title: Farnese 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colline Pescaresi)

description: Bressan proves that Pinot Grigio can obtain sky high levels of sophistication. This saturated, almost amber-colored wine is rich with opulent honey, apricot, maple syrup, baked pear and pungent pinesap. It's extremely rich, long-lasting and sports a complex, almost prickly personality.
title: Bressan 2004 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Here's a thick and resinous Pinot Grigio with a deeply golden color and intense aromas of pine, almond, honey and dried apricot. This is not the light and breezy style of Pinot Grigio you may be familiar with, so look to pair this wine with Tandoori chicken or oven-roasted pasta.
title: Volpe Pasini 2007 Ipso Zuc di Volpe Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Marco Felluga's Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio is a sophisticated and complex white wine that has been enhanced by creamy oak tones. Aromas here include dried apricot, toasted almond, vanilla and baked bread. The wine's texture is rich, dense and very satisfying. Pair this wine with lobster or crab.
title: Marco Felluga 2006 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This is one of the nicest Pinot Grigios available on the market today. From producer Livio Felluga, the wine is rich and creamy with well-balanced acidity that helps keep the palate refreshed. You'll love the aromas of passionfruit, pear and Golden Delicious apple.
title: Livio Felluga 2008 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Steve Clifton takes this common grape on an uncommonly tasty spin, starting with taut and fresh aromas of green-apple flesh, grapefruit pith and light white flowers. The earthy palate shows river-stone and wet-cement minerality but also Key lime and Gravenstein apple warmth, all wrapped up in a compelling texture.
title: Palmina 2015 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: The nose introduces aromas of vanilla wafer and vegetable. This wine feels flabby and uncommitted, with bitter flavors of white fruit, green banana and white pepper. It is neither interesting nor exciting.
title: Cremaschi Furlotti 2010 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Maule Valley)

description: This waxy, stalky Pinot Grigio comes with a can't-miss whiff of corn chips prior to a fleshy, flat palate of bland banana flavors. The dull, chunky finish is on its last legs.
title: Viña Requingua 2014 Los Riscos Pinot Grigio (Curicó Valley)

description: Aromas of freshly cut flowers, green apple, lime and white peach leap from the glass. The creamy texture is brightened by lively acidity. It's simple but well executed.
title: Cantina Produttori Cortaccia 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This structured wine opens with aromas of green apple, pear, clove and a hint of nutmeg that all carry over to the palate along with a mineral note. The creamy texture has nice weight and is brightened by vibrant acidity. Oliver McCrum, T. Edward Wines.
title: Erste Neue 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: For Argentine PG it's attractive. The nose is clean but simple, while the palate is fresh and easy, with driving pineapple and lemon flavors being pushed along by good acidity. Juicy and wet on the finish, and overall it ranks as a nice, fruity wash.
title: Callia 2009 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: Longoria's best Pinot Grigio yet, and one of the better ones out there. It's wonderfully clean and crisp, with rich, spicy flavors of citrus fruits, flowers, vanilla and honey.
title: Longoria 2010 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Aromas of wilted white flowers and ground herbs are followed by off-dry drinking fruit flavors, with peanut shell notes on the finish.
title: Mellisoni 2016 Estate Pinot Grigio (Lake Chelan)

description: Another faintly copper-hued Pinot Grigio from the Oatley family, this one offers modest apple, melon and citrus notes, medium body and a slightly tannic edge to the tart, lemony finish. Drink now.
title: James Oatley 2010 Tic Tok Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

description: Honeydew melon, just-sliced Gala apple and wet-cement aromas show on the nose of this bottling that starts to take on Jolly Rancher sour-apple scents. The simple palate is round and easy to enjoy, with ripe, slightly sweet green-apple flavors.
title: Bianchi 2015 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: Off-dry and direct in citrus, apricot, green apple and honey flavors, this easy-drinking wine is refreshed with crisp acidity. Good now as a cocktail sipper.
title: Luna 2009 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This wine has lots going for it. It's bone dry and clean, with bright, perky flavors of chamomile tea, sour lemon candy, vanilla, wildflowers, and something rich and exotic, like sweet dates. A great job at a versatile, complex young wine, and easy to find, with 130,000 cases produced.
title: Clos du Bois 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Cool-climate northern Italian whites show exceptional fragrant or floral qualities. Tones of jasmine and peach blossom are evident in this crips, easy-drinking Pinot Grigio.
title: Cantina Produttori Bolzano S. Maddalena/Gries 2010 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This wine is a combo of Paso Robles and Edna Valley. The Paso fruit brings slightly cooked, jammy pear and apricot flavors, while the San Luis Obispo grapes provide balancing acidity and a keen lime edge. The result is dry and easy.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2006 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: This is a grassy and lemony expression of Pinot Grigio with easy lines and a touch of bright acidity on the close. Pair the wine with Thai mango salad.
title: Natale Verga 2012 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Made with organically-farmed fruit, this simple Pinot Grigio shows easy melon and citrus backed by yellow candy and a slightly waxy feel on the close.
title: TerrAmore 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Light aromas of apple, pear and petroleum jelly are followed by crisp acid-driven flavors. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

description: This is a well-made, delicately floral style of Pinot Grigio, with notes of apple blossoms, crisp tree fruits and bracing minerals that add length and texture.
title: Wind Rose 2011 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish.
title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Here's a simple Pinot Grigio from Abruzzo with pretty aromas of white flowers. The palate offers bright green apple and pear flavors with a crisp and refreshing finish. Pair this with light pasta salads.
title: Spinelli 2012 STLTO Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

description: This straightforward white offers subdued aromas of banana, orchard fruit and wildflower while the slender palate shows tangerine zest, rennet apple and a mineral note. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp close.
title: Caldaro 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This rather deeply hued, yellow-gold wine offers aromas suggesting orchard fruit, toasted almond and crushed rock. The palate shows tart apple and green pear accompanied by vibrant acidity.
title: Marco Scolaris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Extremely light in color and shy on the nose, this is closer to water than wine. The flavors are also faint, recalling only slight touches of red apple and pear.
title: Reyes 2016 Renaissance Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Melon and citrus aromas are clean and easy, not pungent. This feels good, with limited but solid white-grapefruit and orange flavors. A dry juicy finish tastes mildly bitter but isn't too severe.
title: Finca la Celia 2016 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Uco Valley)

description: Almost neutral in flavor, this light and smooth wine is innocuous, crisp and refreshing.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Rosso & Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Food friendly, informal and bright, this easy-drinking Pinot Grigio opens with bright citrus, stone fruit and melon. There's a touch of white almond paste on the close that recalls the warm Tuscan sunshine.
title: Banfi 2010 Le Rime Pinot Grigio (Toscana)

description: Previously known as Feudo Arancio, Stemmari is a beautiful estate in Sicily owned by the Mezzacorona Group in northern Italy. This sun-drenched expression of Pinot Grigio offers aromas of ripe melon, dried grass and stone fruit.
title: Stemmari 2011 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: Rich and spicy, with oak-influenced green apple, pear, peach and citrus flavors, brightened with fine acidity. The finish seems pretty sweet, making the wine more off-dry than dry.
title: Terlato 2010 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright citrus and bitter almond give this a sharp, tonic personality. Pair this easy, food-friendly wine with sushi or Thai food.
title: Tenuta Polvaro 2010 Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

description: Very easy and fresh, this offers a quick succession of grapefruit, apricot and lemongrass aromas. It's a simple wine that should taste great with summer salads.
title: Anna Spinato 2011 Pinot Grigio (Marca Trevigiana)

description: Cavit is an important wine cooperative in northern Italy that is largely responsible for Pinot Grigio's immense popularity in the United States. This bottle shows easy tones of peach and citrus.
title: Cavit 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fresh floral and peach-like aromas emerge from the nose of this pristine expression of Pinot Grigio from sunny Sicily. You'll get aromas of chopped herb, lemon and yellow rose. The mouthfeel is zesty and bright. Highly recommended at this low price.
title: MandraRossa 2008 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: There's a very crisp and pristine quality to this Pinot Grigio that seems to shine through thanks to the intensity of its citrus, peach and melon aromas. The wine is fresh and lively on the palate.
title: Albino Armani 2011 Corvara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: This is a relatively simple, fruity quaff, filled to the brim with pears, apples and melons. It's medium-bodied, with a bit of apple- or pear-skin texture that gives it additional interest. Drink now.
title: Stable Hill 2016 Palamino Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

description: Slightly sweet and simple, with the tart flavor of sour pineapple candy. Crisp acidity earns it an extra point.
title: Andretti 2008 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: A straw yellow color, with pink tinges, this bright wine is zesty and juicy at the same time. It has a round body and full mouthfeel, with flavors of green apple, Bartlett pear and citrus blossoms. There's bracing lime-juice acidity on the finish.
title: Giocato 2012 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

description: Estate grown and seeming to hint at some time in oak, this dry and lightly spicy wine features apple and pear fruit, already smooth and rounded and ready to drink. More in the style of Oregon Pinot Gris than Italian Pinot Grigio.
title: Locati Cellars 2009 Pinot Grigio (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Honey, peach, citrus and dried herbs comprise the nose of this simple Pinot Grigio. In appearance, the wine is almost transparent with a touch of gold and the mouthfeel is equally light and easy. The screwcap bottle has a cute picture of a green Vespa on the label to reinforce its all-Italy, Dolce Vita appeal.
title: Adria Vini 2006 Rapido White Pinot Grigio (Provincia di Pavia)

description: This is a pleasant, highly quaffable Grigio with a lean, watery appearance and measured aromas of peach, citrus, dried hay and honey. It has a lively, citrus-driven mouthfeel with a touch of playful spice on the close.
title: Teresa Raiz 2006 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This opens with delicate aromas reminiscent of white spring flower and a whiff of orchard fruit. On the palate, fresh acidity underscores creamy Bartlett pear and nectarine zest that lead to a clean, bright finish.
title: Schiopetto 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Enticing scents of chamomile, white spring flower and white stone fruit mingle together in the glass. The creamy full-bodied palate doles out ripe honeydew melon, juicy yellow pear and nectarine zest while a ginger note adds depth. A far cry from the many bland Pinot Grigios that flood the market, this one is loaded with personality.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: The wine opens with a strong mineral tone that recalls crushed white stone and slate. You'll also get drying aromas of mint, herb and white pepper with floral nuances in the back. It tastes crisp, clean and tonic.
title: Bosco del Merlo 2008 Pinot Grigio (Lison-Pramaggiore)

description: Intense aromas of mature pear and Granny Smith apples carry over to the palate along with lemon-lime and honey dew melon. Crisp acidity gives this a clean, refreshing finish.
title: Sirch 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This lively wine is loaded with sensations of spring wildflowers, tart green apple, pear and nectarine. Crisp acidity gives a refreshing finish. Enjoy this as an apéritif or pair it with summer salads.
title: Collavini 2013 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This is a fine, dry, crisp sipper with rewarding flavors of citrus fruits, figs, wildflowers, honey, thyme and pepper. With its crisp acidity and oak-tinged creamy texture, its spectrum falls between Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Sunstone 2007 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Although Argentina is hardly Pinot Grigio country, this is a tropical-style quaffer with good balance and enough acidity to avoid coming across heavy. Creamy aromas of melon and lychee set up flavors of nectarine and tangerine. A lasting but modest finish is fair and appropriate.
title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This smells like crisp green apples, tastes just a bit richer than it smells, has medium body and a touch of crisp acidity. The strong points are the tangy mouthfeel, fruity aromas and overall freshness.
title: Rebusity 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: In this price range, this is one of the best Pinot Grigios on the market. It's just slightly off-dry, with excellent acidity providing balance to the citrus, green apple and tropical fruit flavors.
title: Guenoc 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Dry, ultra-crisp and fruity, with citrusy flavors of lemons, limes and grapefruits that finish with a flowery taste. A clean, versatile white wine for cocktails.
title: McManis 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This fresh, appealing wine is lightly spritzy, with flavors of pear and melon that show persistence.
title: Anew 2014 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Funky, off-base floral aromas and a sweet, cotton candy flavor profile. Feels flat and sugary to the end, with a nip of bitter almond.
title: Graffigna 2007 Centenario Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

description: Made in a familiar style for those who enjoy easy and fresh Pinot Grigio, Borgo Crosaris is appropriate for informal summer lunches on the patio. Citrus, peach and cut grass are the most obvious aromatic elements.
title: Tenute Grandi & Gabana 2011 Borgo Crosaris Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

description: Sweetly fragrant, with hints of pear and melon. The palate is wet, lean and acidic, which helps push the lychee and melon flavors. A clean, light, mild refresher with sharper-than-expected acids. Nothing more than that.
title: Callia 2008 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: Enticing fragrances suggest alpine wild flower, stone fruit and savory herb. The linear palate is loaded with finesse and character, delivering creamy green apple, tangerine, mineral, white peach and mint. It's well balanced with bright acidity.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

description: This is an easy white wine with balanced acidity. There's a spicy note of crushed clove or exotic spice at the start that is smoothed out by softer aromas of peach cobbler and lemon mousse.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2010 Casoli Maniago Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A full-bodied white, it leads with aromas of jasmine, honeysuckle and stone fruit. The linear palate offers ripe golden apple, white peach and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity. Bitter almond marks the finish.
title: Niedermayr Josef 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This uber-informal wine has faint aromas that recall pressed wildflower and a whiff of pear. The simple, diluted palate shows hints of apple skin and a bitter medicinal note alongside brisk acidity.
title: Lechthaler 2014 Torre di Luna Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Light, citrusy aromas also are suggestive of bath soap. The feel is juicy yet innocuous, while flavors of tropical fruits finish mild and simple. This is the definition of a quaffing wine.
title: Callia 2013 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: White spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of Alpine herb come together on this delicious, structured white. The juicy, full-bodied palate offers white peach, mature pear and tangerine alongside bright acidity that lifts the creamy flavors. A precise mineral note closes the lingering finish and lends finesse.
title: Elena Walch 2015 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Aromas of lemon zest, lemongrass and lime juice prepare the palate for flavors of freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, tart apple and white peach. The finish is brisk and pleasantly acidic.
title: Purcari 2015 1827 Pinot Grigio (Moldova)

description: Loaded with ripe pear, muskmelon and tropical fruit, this is a medium-bodied, plump white with crowd appeal. It seems a bit off dry, but closes on a citrusy note.
title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Two Lands Pinot Grigio (Australia)

description: Grown in steeply terraced mountain vineyards, this crisp, bright wine has aromas of white spring flowers, chamomile and ripe pear. The refreshing palate offers juicy green apple, citrus and a hint of mineral alongside zesty acidity.
title: Cliffhanger 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Fragrances suggest ripe apple, Bartlett pear and a whiff of alpine wildflower. The medium-bodied, linear palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and juicy citrus alongside crisp acidity that gives it a bright, clean finish.
title: Kettmeir 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Clean and crisp in acidity, this polished PG features citrus fruit, pear, white flower and spice flavors. It's a racy, mouth-cleansing wine that's nice as an apéritif as the day comes to a close.
title: Murphy-Goode 2008 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Nervy, herbal aromas and vivid grapefruit alongside lemon flavors make this wine stand out from the pack. It is light to medium in body and has a crisp, tangy texture and refreshing finish.
title: McManis 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A very nice wine, and more proof, if it's needed, that PG can make a crisp, interesting dry white even at an everyday price. Acidity is high and clean, giving a vibrancy to the citrus, honeysuckle, mineral and vanilla flavors.
title: Little Black Dress 2006 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This easy Pinot Grigio is marked by ripe orange, peach, tropical fruit and green apple flavors, brightened with crisp, mouthwatering acidity. Moderate in alcohol, it's a versatile, lush white wine to drink now.
title: Coastline 2012 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: Lightly aromatic with notes of yellow apple, pear and melon. It drinks off dry, with the sugar seeming out of place but followed by an extended finish with clarifying acidity.
title: Tsillan 2013 Estate Pinot Grigio (Lake Chelan)

description: This Pinot Grigio has a slightly greenish hue and fragrant aromas of citrus, white flower and exotic fruit. You can really taste its sunny Sicilian roots: the wine has light density but is fuller and softer than wines from the north.
title: Feudo Arancio 2007 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: This wine has a personality that's both crisp and satisfying. White pepper and light earth aromas lead to tempting peachy flavors and an appealing texture that balances tanginess and richness. The blend includes small portions of Chardonnay, Albariño, Gewürztraminer and Orange Muscat.
title: Estancia 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This wine's citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit aromas lead to a tangy palate. Round and savory, it doles out creamy green apple, white peach and tangerine drop flavors.
title: Tenuta Luisa 2015 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Lots of Anjou pear and Fuji apple flavors enrich this medium-bodied and refreshing wine. It has a light straw color and open flavors of ripe fruit and citrus. The texture is very smooth, and the finish has a touch of ripe-fruit sweetness.
title: Mirassou 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: From a dynamic, family-run wine estate in northern Italy, this light Pinot Grigio offers aromas of lemon soda, peach and tangerine skin.
title: Stival 2010 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Aromas of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of wet flint float from the glass. Fresh and savory, the juicy palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple, nectarine and lemon drop alongside bright acidity. Notes of almond and ginger add depth.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Rive Alte Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: Fleshy and floral, this is a delightfully light, dry and tropical wine, with primary characteristics of apple and lime. Refreshing, it'll serve well as a versatile companion on the table or as as worthy apéritif, finishing in grassy fig and pear.
title: Black Stallion 2014 Limited Release Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This rosé gets its pretty eye-of-the-partridge color from having undergone cold soaking. Dry, soft and subtle, it shows peach, vanilla and spice flavors. Great with cioppino or grilled salmon.
title: Morovino 2011 Avila Beach Sunset Dry Rosé of Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: While the orange, pear and green apple flavors of this Pinot Grigio seem sweetened by the vanilla and honey notes, the wine's brisk acidity balances it and makes finish dry and clean. This will make for a fine apéritif, and it will also pair well with slightly sweet Chinese, Vietnamese and Cambodian fare.
title: Benessere 2011 Pinot Grigio (Carneros)

description: This is pale blush colored, with aromas of rose petal, jasmine blossom and fresh picked strawberry that continue seamlessly onto the palate. It's got a great strawberry zing on the finish, with bright, balanced acidity.
title: Pullus 2012 Dry White Pinot Grigio (Štajerska)

description: Exotic to the point that one wonders whether other varieties have been blended in, with spicy hints of cardamom, cinnamon and clove, followed by ripe melon flavors. At least this is not a bland, neutral effort, although it may have a touch of residual sugar. Drink now.
title: Black Swan 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: A chilly vintage took its toll on this Maddalena, robbing the wine of ripeness and resulting in a green, slightly vegetal wine.
title: Maddalena 2010 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: Simple and refreshing, this opens with a light floral fragrance and a whiff of pear. The easy palate offers tart green apple and a citrus note alongside bright acidity.
title: Cabert 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Fresh and food friendly, this has light aromas of citrus, peach and caramel. The wine is immediate and direct thanks to its natural freshness.
title: Villa Rubini 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A semisweet wine, with apricot jam and citrus flavors, offset by crisp acidity. Turns cloying after a few sips.
title: Francis Coppola 2009 Diamond Collection Emerald Label Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The aromas of apple and pear are light, seeming to show some lees influence. Flavors are dry and straight down the fairway on this innocuous easy drinker.
title: Original House Wine NV Pinot Grigio (America)

description: A delightful Pinot Grigio, perfect for drinking as an appetizer wine, or with anything from fried chicken to Vietnamese pho. It's crisp in acidity, which gives a balanced structure to the ripe lime, apple and peach fruit flavors.
title: Domino 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Fermented in oak barrels, this has aromas that recall white flower, toasted oak, baked pear and dried apricot. The palate offers butterscotch and mature Golden Delicious apple alongside fresh acidity. Toasted hazelnut signals the finish.
title: Lis Neris 2012 Gris Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: Peter Zemmer produces an enjoyable and pristine expression of Pinot Grigio that really hones in on the freshness and simplicity of the grape. The finish is marked by tones of citrus, pear and white peach.
title: Peter Zemmer 2010 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Pinot Grigio Campodipietra is a zesty, fresh wine to pair with appetizers or fried finger foods. It offers the characteristic easiness and informality of the grape variety with a soft, creamy mouthfeel that is typical of the Piave wine region in northern Italy.
title: Dogarina 2009 Campodipietra Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Here's an informal, easygoing white that offers sensations of banana, peach and pear. It's simple and refreshing, with brisk acidity.
title: Italo Cescon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Fun and fresh, this informal white offers whiffs of white flower and pear. The straightforward palate presents notes of apple and peach alongside lively acidity. It's not complex, but it is well made.
title: Lagaria 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Light scents of spring blossom and pear waft out of the glass. The simple palate is rather diluted and decidedly lean, showing hints of apple skin, mineral and brisk acidity.
title: Tenuta Peter Sölva & Söhne 2014 I Vigneti Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This wine has more body and a richer mouthfeel than many of its peers, with mild floral and almond flavors and a touch of butterscotch.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a light easy-drinking style that fills the quaffable white wine bill quite nicely. It's lemony and tart, with a slice of orange peel for extra interest.
title: Apolloni 2015 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

description: It opens with fragrances of white spring flowers and mature pear. The bright palate delivers Granny Smith apple, tangerine and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
title: Poggiobello 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
