description: Judging from the appearance of this crystalline and seemingly colorless wine, you can anticipate that it might be one of those watery expressions of Pinot Grigio that we see so much of in the USA. Sure enough: this wine offers very little in terms of aromatics or density.
title: Oggi! 2008 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: This has medicinal herb and adhesive bandage aromas that carry over to the lean palate. Racy acidity and a bitter note give it a firm, brisk finish.
title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: The wine smells and tastes like fresh, crisp pippin apples, has a lively, refreshing texture and soothing fruity aftertaste.
title: One Leaf 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is distinguished for its deeply-rich mouthfeel and creamy aromas of stone fruit, honeydew and crushed almond. There's a point of crisp acidity that's refreshing.
title: Livio Felluga 2010 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: There's not much intensity here but this simple Grigio works just fine for informal occasions. Aromas include honey, stone fruit and citrus and the wine offers a fresh, lean texture accented by zesty crispness.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2006 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Wildflower, citrus and grapefruit color the aromatic profile of this easy, no-fuss Grigio. It has soda-like flavors of lemon and lime and is an easy and quick-drinking wine overall.
title: Castello di Porcìa 2007 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Here's a PG with a slight hint of effervescence and aromas of stone fruit, mango and citrus. It has floral fragrances. too, that render a slightly sweet sensation in the mouth.
title: Folonari 2007 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Refreshing and simple, this is dryish and spicy, with orange, apricot and peach flavors all accented with crisp acidity. It's easy to drink as a cocktail sipper, with little snacks, like tempura or cheesy puff pastries.
title: McManis 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Packaged in a short, squat bottle, this a clean, modern wine, with bright aromas of cut grass, apricot and bright lemon zest.
title: Astoria 2011 Alìsia Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This is an easy white wine with balanced acidity. There's a spicy note of crushed clove or exotic spice at the start that is smoothed out by softer aromas of peach cobbler and lemon mousse.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2010 Casoli Maniago Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Gold in color, with oxidized aromas of straw, almond skins, butterscotch and baked apple, this PG is fading fast. Flavors of apple and briny stone fruits finish with almondy notes and bitterness.
title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2012 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This is a beautifully fragrant Pinot Grigio, with a sharp, tangy, brightly-acidic finish. It's characterized by peach, melon and citrus and the high alcohol does not go totally unnoticed.
title: St. Pauls 2010 Egg Leiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Green apple and citrus aromas float out of the glass while the bright, straightforward palate offers Bartlett pear and juicy nectarine zest. Tangy acidity leaves a crisp finish.
title: Petrucco 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Muted scents of orchard fruit and a touch of almond lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers pear, citrus zest and mineral accompanied by bracing acidity.
title: Ronco Blanchis 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Aromas of hazelnut, orchard fruit and a confectionary note lead the nose. The bright palate offers crisp green apple and lemon drop alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
title: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Its mix of heady aromas include chamomile flower, Spanish broom and yellow stone. The bright, fresh palate offers peach, pear, crunchy apple and a touch of mineral alongside vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
title: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Aristos Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Scents of white flower, pear and a hint of ground almond emerge on this lively white. The vibrant palate offers green apple and a hint of mineral alongside racy acidity.
title: Castello di Spessa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This is a simple, correct PG with aromas of citrus and grapefruit backed by a hint of almond. It also offers good a balance between sweet fruit flavors and spicy acidity.
title: Rocca Bernarda 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Pretty fragrances and freshness characterize this popular Pinot Grigio with aromas of stone fruit, acacia flower and honeydew melon. It's a simple, easy wine with a thin consistency but those floral aromas help make it stand out in a crowd.
title: Santa Margherita 2007 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fruity, clean, and on the sweet side, this is an everyday quaffer whose sugary flavors are just fine for a sunny afternoon with ripe peaches or apricots. ItÕs Cailfornia soft, a country style wine that will appeal to those who find some whites tart or sour.
title: Forest Glen 2000 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Livelier than usual in texture and popping with bright citrus aromas and flavors, this light-bodied and barrel-fermented wine is a great palate-cleanser and will pair beautifully with dishes like raw oysters and herbed goat cheese. It smells and tastes like lemon, lime, green apple and kiwi, and has great balance.
title: Monte Volpe 2013 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino)

description: Pinot Grigio can be made in almost any style, but Seghesio nails the dry, elegant approach. This is a terrific wine, mouthwateringly tart, and the lime flavor is satisfying. Unoaked, this is so versatile, you can drink it with almost anything calling for a dry white, or all by itself as an apéritif.
title: Seghesio 2011 Pinot Grigio (Sonoma County)

description: Although its fresh lemon and savory apple flavors are pleasant, this is clumsy and disjointed with a soapy, floral nose and shriekingly high acidity levels.
title: Chaddsford 2009 Pinot Grigio (Pennsylvania)

description: Part of a wine series made from indigenous varieties of northeast Italy, this easy-going effort shows medium structure, with a creamy fullness. The finish has bright endnotes of cut grass, lime and honeydew. It's perfect for appetizers or light summer lunches.
title: Sirch 2011 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: A combination of grapes from around the county has produced a complex, nuanced wine. It has that dry-sweet thing going on, with no measurable sugar but layers of fruity, flowery flavors, and quite bright acids. It feels fat and oily in the mouth, and even has a touch of spicy oak. Best Buy. —S.H.
title: Babcock 2001 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: A light, easy-drinking Pinot Grigio, with peach, lime and fresh herb aromas and flavors. The lemony finish shows fine persistence.
title: Pozzi 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Light and easy to drink, with just enough apple and lime to keep things interesting. Makes a fine apéritif.
title: Barone Fini 2002 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Slightly gingery on the nose, but marked more by fresh greens and limes. Its relatively lightweight flavors of apples and limes are joined by an herbal tang on the short but refreshing finish.
title: Conti Formentini 2001 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Musky pear aromas start things off, but the flavors are in sharper focus—a blend of pears and green herbs, finishing with a touch of anise. A bit sweet-tasting, so serve well-chilled as an apéritif. Best Buy.
title: La Francesca 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Light. Light in color, light in body, light on flavor. What's there is pretty—featuring hints of peaches, mint and lime—so this is best as an apéritif. It runs the risk of being overpowered by food.
title: Torre di Luna 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This structured Pinot Grigio boasts aromas of yellow spring flowers, exotic fruit, citrus and a hint of Alpine herbs. The juicy, vibrant palate delivers green apple, pear, white peach and citrus allied with fresh acidity.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2012 Söll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: From the Adriatic side of the Italian peninsula comes this fresh Pinot Grigio that would wash down seafood, vegetables or light appetizers. The wine is crisp, clean and redolent of citrus and green apple.
title: Caldora Vini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colline Pescaresi)

description: Opening aromas include green apple, Bartlett pear, white peach, mineral and lemon zest. The juicy palate is balanced with fresh acidity and it closes on a hint of white almond.
title: Volpe Pasini 2012 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose on this lively white. The fresh, easy-drinking palate offers ripe green apple, peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.
title: Alta Luna 2015 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Cavit is an important wine cooperative in northern Italy that is largely responsible for Pinot Grigio's immense popularity in the United States. This bottle shows easy tones of peach and citrus.
title: Cavit 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This no-fuss wine is redolent of lemon soda, cut grass and bitter almond. The mouthfeel is clean and fresh.
title: Barone 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fresh, tart and crisp, this balances its natural acidity against sun-ripened aromas of peach and honeydew.
title: Villa Rubini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Bright and clean, this drinks easily thanks to its fresh aromas of citrus and stone fruit. The compact, crisp mouthfeel finishes with a touch of grated lemon zest.
title: Ruffino 2011 Lumina Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Easy and fresh, with a simple, crisp finish, this should pair with garden greens or sliced tomato and mozzarella
title: Caposaldo 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Very simple and straightforward, this bright wine opens with aromas of lime, cut grass and white peach. It's crisp and lean on the finish.
title: Angelini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: From its slight tinge of copper this wine appears to have had some skin contact, and perhaps that can account for it's almost Pinot Noir-like aromas of strawberries and sous bois. Stone fruit and citrus flavors are round on the palate, then finish fresh and vibrant, underscored by crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Marlargo 2006 Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

description: Freshly squeezed lemons, lime and pretty white florals perfume this dry, medium-bodied Pinot Grigio. The palate is clean with juicy white grapefruit flavors and some interesting minerality, but it's a bit lacking in concentration.
title: Raffaldini 2009 Pinot Grigio (Swan Creek)

description: This is a radically different Pinot Grigio that opens with a golden color and offers aromas of caramel, butterscotch and candied fruit. The mouthfeel is creamy and luscious. It's released after many years of cellar aging, and the process to make it is very sophisticated and labor-intensive.
title: Bressan 2006 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Almost as light in color as water, this is a straight-ahead take on the grape, with tropical-leaning aromas of honeysuckle, ripe papaya and boisterous passionfruit. The palate is much grassier in style, showing cut lawn, kiwi, green pears and kaffir limes, with just a touch of lingering tropical sweetness.
title: Robert Renzoni 2014 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

description: Delicate fragrances recall white wild flowers and white tree fruit. The bright, medium-bodied palate delivers tart green apple, mature pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
title: Colutta 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A structured Pinot Grigio, it discloses aromas of fragrant white flowers, apple, pear and a hint of beeswax. The lively palate offers Granny Smith apple and citrus alongside zesty acidity. A subtle mineral note marks the close.
title: Muri-Gries 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Melon, peach and honey are the driving forces behind this easy white wine. In the mouth, it delivers pretty fruit nuances and lean structure that closes on a high, fresh note. It's great for sipping by the pool in the hot months of summer.
title: La Tunella 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Besides the usual notes of citrus, pear and peach usually associated with Pinot Grigio, this expression offers added dimension in the form of roasted almonds. It has a creamy, honey-rich nose backed by chewy sweetness and refreshing zest. It's nice to see more screwcaps from Italy, especially on these light, easy wines.
title: Villa Pozzi 2006 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: With some Pinot Blanc blended in for richness, this wine has a honeyed edge to the lemon, pineapple and pear fruit flavors. It's crisp with Monterey acidity.
title: Pinot Patch 2012 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: This wine's oak and butterscotch aromas follow through to the lean palate, along with hints of toasted nut. Although linear and focused, it doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the evident oak.
title: Marco Felluga 2013 Mongris Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This assertive, dry wine has wet stone and cured meat aromas and tart, mouth-cleansing grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It will make a fine foil for rich foods like fettucine alfredo or fried chicken.
title: Ironstone 2015 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Aromas of Golden Delicious apples, nectarine flesh, lemon-lime soda and poached pears drizzled lightly with agave syrup show on the nose of this wine made by Mike Roth. The palate offers apple and pear cider along with white peach and a steely, nearly gunmetal minerality.
title: Piro Piro Piccolo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Just-squeezed lime aromas mesh with riper green and yellow apples and wet stone on the nose of this simple yet quaffable boxed wine. The flavors lack energy, but show familiar apple and lime characteristics.
title: Jewelry Box 2013 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: This Pinot Grigio Reserve boasts a creamy and attractive mouthfeel that is accented by fresh aromas of peach, citrus, grapefruit, yellow flower and toasted almond. It is an immensely food-friendly wine that would pair well with creamy pasta or baked fish.
title: San Giuseppe 2007 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Aromas of peach blossom and mature Bartlett pear lead the nose on this pretty wine. The crisp palate offers green apple and juicy nectarine alongside bright acidity.
title: La Cappuccina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Pretty aromas of white spring blossoms and Bartlett pear lead the nose on this bright, easy-drinking white. The lively palate offers tart green-apple and light mineral notes alongside crisp acidity.
title: Mezzacorona 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Livio Felluga adds a creamy, sophisticated edge to its Pinot Grigio that elevates the wine in terms of food pairing opportunities. Instead of appetizers and easy finger foods, this wine can stand up to fish, white meat and pasta. It has fragrant notes of creamy peach, citrus, white stone and pineapple followed by a shapely, dense structure.
title: Livio Felluga 2007 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Part of a wine series made from indigenous varieties of northeast Italy, this easy-going effort shows medium structure, with a creamy fullness. The finish has bright endnotes of cut grass, lime and honeydew. It's perfect for appetizers or light summer lunches.
title: Sirch 2011 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: This is fresh, with lush layers of peach, melon, lemon zest and white flower. It's an easy effort, boasting good structure and staying power.
title: Ermacora 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Sweetness marks this wine, giving it a sugary finish. The flavors are jammy, of pineapples, oranges and apricots. A good hit of acidity provides vital balance.
title: Pietra Santa 2010 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Cienega Valley)

description: Pressed flower, pear and crushed rock aromas lead the nose. The lively palate offers lime, green apple skin and mineral alongside racy acidity.
title: Fiegl 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: The nose isn't very expressive but it eventually reveals delicate whiffs of white spring flower and green apple that carry over to the palate along with a hint of citrus. Racy acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish.
title: Subida di Monte 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This straightforward, refreshing white opens with light scents of Spanish broom and a whiff of crushed stone. The palate is on the lean side, showing crisp apple, pear and a hint of mineral alongside brisk acidity.
title: Kössler 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Lightly perfumed with hawthorn flower and orchard fruit aromas, this linear white offers flavors of green apple, lime and tangerine zest. Crisp acidity supports the palate while a mineral note closes the tangy finish.
title: Erste Neue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Absolutely dry and tingly in acidity, this citrus-flavored wine is clean and zesty. It's a fine appetizer sipper for cleansing the palate. Serve it with little munchies, like grilled veggies, goat cheese and crackers with crab salad.
title: Oak Grove 2009 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Tastes old, even though it's only from 2008, with some oxidized notes. It's a bone-dry wine, but those citrus and flower flavors are tired.
title: Swanson 2008 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Starts off with fresh but simple aromas of apple wedges, greens and limes, but shows altogether more interesting flavors—the apple and citrus are complemented by hints of oil or shale. Turns minerally on the finish.
title: Banear 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Not a typically fruity Grigio, this one relies more on spices and minerals to make a palate impression. Hints of almond and dried cinnamon start things off, followed by stony, mineral flavors backed by pears and allspice.
title: Villa Carra 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: The bestselling Pinot Grigio on the market is full of forward fruit and balancing acidity. It succeeds in epitomizing why Pinot Grigio is so popular, with its slight spice and crisp, soft, clean and fresh flavors, with just a touch of citrus and lychees.
title: Santa Margherita 2002 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Subdued aromas of pressed acacia flower, hay and beeswax take shape in the glass. The mature palate offers ripe yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside a note of toasted almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
title: Villa Russiz 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Dry and crisp, but so watered down, there's practically nothing there. Shows the barest hint of of citrus and flower flavors.
title: Surf Point 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Made with a bit of skin contact, this pale copper-hued wine boasts scents of dusty earth and cantaloupe. Melon and apple-skin flavors mingle easily on the palate, ending with some light tannins and mouthwatering acids. Drink now–2011.
title: Robert Oatley 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

description: Luminous and bright, this well-priced Pinot Grigio doles out fresh fruit flavors of peach, apricot and tangerine. The wine is lean and firm with an easygoing approach and spicy crispness on the finish.
title: Blason 2007 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: A bit heavy, with ripe flavors of apricots, pears and oranges. There's a hint of sweetness. It's a rustic wine, but serve it cold at big parties and don't worry.
title: Main & Geary 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Apple, citrus and yellow floral aromas are what hits the nose first. Them they carry over to the simple, zesty palate along with green pear and a note of bitter nut. Bracing acidity generates a clean finish.
title: Ca'Ronesca 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This fun, copper-colored wine offers aromas of cut grass and Bartlett pear. The simple palate shows white peach and green apple alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
title: Casata Monfort 2014 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Chamomile flower and yellow stone fruit aromas are the primary aromas. The simple, straightforward palate tastes of yellow apple skin, a hint of white peach and a touch of mineral alongside crisp acidity.
title: Colterenzio 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Aromas of hawthorn and a spring orchard in bloom lead the nose while the bright, straightforward palate offers green apple, bitter almond and a mineral note. Crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.
title: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Here's a classic example of why Americans are buying Pinot Grigio. The wine is marked by fresh, zesty acidity that cleanses the palate and is so compatible with things like goat cheese and grilled veggies. Very slightly sweet, it shows flavors of limes, Meyer lemons, pineapples and clover honey.
title: Meridian 2006 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas of snap peas and minerals come in front of grapefruit, apple and lemon flavors. This wine has both a stony, crisp core as well as a plump, chewy texture. The finish is at once tangy and lean, but also fairly driven. Not an easy wine to wrap your arms around and assess, but not bad either.
title: Pepi 2001 Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

description: This simple, slightly sweet Pinot Grigio has some veggie-like underripeness, but offers enough orange and peach fruit to satisfy.
title: Beautiful Dream 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas of white peach, flint and hint of banana carry over to the round, ripe palate along with green apple and a note of juicy tangerine. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors and leads to a bright, clean finish.
title: Jermann 2015 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

description: Modest aromas of cut grass, white flower and citrus establish this as an easy-drinking white. The finish is marked with a touch of green lime. It should pair well with shrimp cocktail or basil pesto.
title: Bosco del Merlo 2011 Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

description: Redolent of fresh citrus, peach, pear and fragrant white flower, this is a wine to drink on a hot summer day by the pool.
title: Canaletto 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: If you catch this wine soon, meaning before it goes belly up, you may like its peachy simplicity and ample palate weight. Lychee, melon and spiced-meat flavors are interesting up to a point, and the finish is generic, soft and clean. Drink immediately.
title: Graffigna 2008 Centenario Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

description:
Brisk and clean, this dry white is the 
anti-Chardonnay, marked by tart citrus flavors that make it versatile with a wide range of foods.
title: Montevina 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Throwing a party? Need plenty of white wine to make the rounds? This is the solution. With slightly sweet apricot, orange and vanilla flavors, it's clean, brisk and likeable.
title: Bota Box 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The packaging stands out with its tiny grape cutting that's tied to the bottle's neck. This is a bright wine that's redolent of lemon soda, chalky candy (like Pez) and apricot.
title: Cantina Zaccagnini 2011 Dal Tralcetto Pinot Grigio (Colline Pescaresi)

description: Here's an Italian-styled Pinot Grigio, with a gently nutty nose and earthy low notes. It's faintly oily in the mouth but finishes crisp and light, with a pretty lemon zest accent. Drink up.
title: Redbank 2008 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: Elegant and sophisticated, this has soft aromas of apricot, honey, citrus and pear. Fresh acidity is followed by a touch of savory spice.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2011 Söll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Here's a pretty Pinot Grigio that offers a heady fragrance of white flowers and Granny Smith apple. On the palate, this offers creamy green apple and pear flavors, uplifted by fresh acidity.
title: Lungarotti 2012 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

description: Aged only in stainless steel, this crisp effort shows subtle aromas of toasted almond and butter backed by notes of stone fruit and dried grass. It finishes with a rich, smooth texture.
title: Petrucco 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Great for easy seafood or pasta dishes, this is fresh, with crisp acidity backed by notes of stone fruit, melon and yellow rose.
title: Pighin 2011 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Fresh and easy going, this offers generous fullness and intense notes of apricot, honeydew and Golden Delicious apple.
title: Gaierhof 2010 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This opens with fragrant aromas of yellow rose, apricot, butterscotch and spicy vanilla. It has edium density, with a fresh mouthfeel lending this a unique personality.
title: Tenuta di Angoris 2010 Vôs da Vigne Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: An enticing fragrance of wildflower, peach blossom, berry and a hint of white pepper lead the nose. The lively, linear palate offers green apple, pear and toasted almond alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Draga 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Scents of cut grass, tomato vine and a hint of honeydew melon emerge on this tangy white. The crisp palate doles out yellow peach, apple, grapefruit and an almond note accompanied by zesty acidity.
title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Honeysuckle, tropical fruit and pear aromas lead the nose. Made with forty-year-old vines, the elegantly structured palate delivers crisp apple, white almond and mineral alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Klausner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Pear and spring flower aromas lead the way on this vibrant white. The bright palate offers yellow apple, candied lemon zest and a touch of mineral alongside fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
title: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Oberfeld Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fermented and aged in large French and Austrian casks, this single vineyard Pinot Grigio opens with aromas that recall oak, yellow apple and candied citrus peel. The round palate offers white peach, vanilla pear, apple and lemon drop alongside racy acidity.
title: Tramin 2014 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Here's a poised, refreshing white that opens with enticing aromas of spring blossom and stone fruit. The luminous palate offers fresh peach, Granny Smith apple and nectarine alongside crisp acidity. A hint of Alpine herb enhances the clean finish.
title: Bottega Vinaia 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Aromas of white spring blossom and pear lead the nose on this bright, straightforward Pinot Grigio. The palate offers tart green apple and citrus alongside crisp acidity.
title: Elena Walch 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Pineapple, citrus blossom, and white peach aromas prepare your palate for tastes of green apple, lemon zest and apricots. The finish is crisp and acidic.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: This light-bodied, dry wine smells fresh and fruity, tastes like crisp apples and honeydew melon, and has a soft texture that makes it easy to sip.
title: Bota Box 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The aromas of this full-bodied sweet-seeming wine are floral and honey-like, followed by rich ripe honeydew melon and peach-syrup flavors and a soft mouth-clinging texture. It's not the usual style, but tasty in its own right.
title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

description: This is a fruity, tropical rendition of grape, showing guava, papaya, coconut and apple aromas on the nose. The palate packs loads of floral character, with more tropical fruit and bubblegum-like flavors that feel ripe but not sweet.
title: Robert Renzoni 2016 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

description: This simple white opens with aromas of honeysuckle and pear while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish. Drink soon.
title: Famiglia Cielo 2016 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This wine is intensely floral and gritty on the palate, showing a fleshy cloying sense of ripeness. Melon, pear and fig highlight the fruit profile.
title: Muscardini 2015 Ansa Di Loval Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of wet flint float from the glass. Fresh and savory, the juicy palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple, nectarine and lemon drop alongside bright acidity. Notes of almond and ginger add depth.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Rive Alte Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: This has zesty acidity that lends a mouthwatering briskness to the citrus, peach and spice flavors. Easy to like as a cocktail sipper, or paired with Chinese food and tempura.
title: Benessere 2010 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This is plump, with an intense bouquet offering loads of yellow rose, apricot and fresh grapefruit. The mouthfeel is silky, soft and round.
title: Tenuta Luisa 2010 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: This “ramato” or copper-hued Pinot Grigio opens with bright aromas of bitter almond, honey, peach and exotic fruit. Its texture is smooth and soft.
title: Bonotto delle Tezze 2010 Montesanto Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: This luminous Pinot Grigio offers sunny aromas of ripe peach, melon and pink grapefruit. The wine plays its cards well in the mouth too, thanks to its creamy but easygoing finish. Pair it with Chinese chicken salad.
title: San Osvaldo 2007 Pinot Grigio (Lison-Pramaggiore)

description: Fairly simple on the nose, but solid, with ripe pears leading the way. The flavors pick up some interesting graphite notes, extending through the minerally finish. Surprisingly full-bodied.
title: Ecco Domani 2002 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Flavors of ripe peaches and fresh, clean fruit make for an immediately attractive wine. It is balanced with a layer of acidity and vibrant white currants.
title: Santi 2002 Sortesele Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Simple, attractive crisp wine, with a pleasant depth of flavor. It has fresh fruit, a light toast touch and soft acidity.
title: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2002 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Atypically gold in color, this also smells atypically ripe, of red apples and strawberries. Flavors are of baked Golden Delicious, complete with a dusting of cinnamon. Low acid makes it plump, and it finishes short.
title: Merk 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: This inexpensive, delicious fresh wine has good depth of concentration and long, vanilla flavors.
title: Kris 2002 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fruity in flavor and nicely rounded in texture, this medium-bodied wine from Napa-based Mason Cellars incorporates grapes from around the state. It has a good balance between lively acidity and rather ripe apple and melon flavors.
title: Three Pears 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Pressed yellow flower and spring orchard fruit are the primary opening scents. The lean palate shows rennet apple skin, lime and a mineral note alongside zesty acidity.
title: Pighin 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Delicate aromas of honeysuckle, white stone fruit and citrus present themselves to the nose while the fun, simple palate shows green pear and a hint of lime. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy close.
title: Castello della Rosa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This presents the nose whiffs of pineapple and wet stone while the lean palate offers rennet apple skin, tangerine and a hint of mineral. Bracing acidity dominates the finish.
title: Cormòns 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This simple white opens with scents of honeysuckle and ripe orchard fruit while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish.
title: Endrizzi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: A bouquet of lemon rind, white flowers and peach prepares the palate for crisp, clean flavors of white peach and apricot. This wine is lean in the mouth, with a pleasantly astringent finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

description: This easy-drinking Pinot Grigio opens with a crystalline appearance and clean citrus, pear and peach aromas. Fresh acidity and a touch of peachy sweetness characterize the mouthfeel.
title: A-Mano 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Okay, this Pinot Grigio is easy, thin and simple, but at this low price it makes the perfect wine for informal occasions, barbecues or pool parties. Peach and citrus are the main aromatic indicators.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Pinot Grigio (Grave del Friuli)

description: This wine's pinkish-coppery hue suggests a bit of skin contact, as does the silky texture on the palate. Hints of gingery spice accent flavors of poached pear, finishing on a dry, dusty note.
title: Fowles Wine 2015 Are You Game? Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: Sulfur shrouds this wine at first, but it dissipates with time to reveal mild notes of honeyed nut, kiwi, white flower and golden apple. The palate has balanced acidity and a slight oiliness, and the flavors seem a bit muted at the moment.
title: General's Ridge 2011 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)

description: This is a simple Pinot Grigio, with aromas of white spring flowers and green apple. The palate is slightly round, with a ripe pear flavor lifted by tart Granny Smith apple accents.
title: Gaierhof 2012 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Puiten is a slightly wider and creamier expression compared to the estate's base Pinot Grigio. The wine shows pretty aromas of peach and citrus as well as a very thick and succulent feel in the mouth.
title: Colterenzio 2009 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is a successful expression of Pinot Grigio thanks to the wine's easy but studied sophistication and its creamy mouthfeel. Food-friendly and upfront, it would make a good match to seafood or white meat.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This pretty ramato style Pinot Grigio (“ramato” refers to the copperish color you see here) delivers clean aromas of citrus, pomegranate, white cherry and a touch of cinnamon spice. Pair this wine with crab cakes or grilled Ahi tuna.
title: Plozner 2009 Malpelo Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Prominent on the nose with scents of apple and pear, this is a dry, medium-bodied Pinot Grigio with subtle nectarine and citrus flavor. It's puckery from acidity, but refreshing with a clean, brisk finish.
title: Belhurst 2011 Pinot Grigio (New York)

description: This is a good, medium-bodied wine with light aromas, fairly neutral flavors and a very clean, straightforward personality. It will suit a crowd.
title: Nica 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Fresh apple, lemon and peach notes are shaded by darker tones of dusty mineral and struck flint in this medium-bodied Pinot Grigio. It's a bit closed in profile, but refreshing and dry with an invigorating lime finish.
title: Suhru 2016 Pinot Grigio (New York)

description: Passion fruit and citrus describe the nose of this crisp but simple Pinot Grigio. The wine is luminous and light and leaves a long citrusy trail on the close. Drink it with friends before coming to the dinner table.
title: Josef Brigl 2007 Sielo Blu Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This savory Pinot Grigio has a little weight on it thanks to grape selection and 20% aging in large barrels. It delivers classic Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear, nutmeg and flint in a creamy texture brightened by fresh acidity.
title: Colterenzio 2012 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: A bit rough and rustic, but packs in plenty of sweet pear-nectar flavors dusted with dried spices.
title: Gaierhof 2001 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: A minty nose blends in some floral and citrus scents as well, giving this light-bodied wine some interest. Flavors are minty, too, verging on wintergreen, and finishing clean and fresh.
title: Nando 2001 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Light but clean, with aromas of anise, pears and green apples and modest flavors of pear, watermelon rind and lime.
title: Soldo 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Smells strongly of lemongrass, and this character carries over onto the palate, which is flavored by lemon, pear and herbs. Feels a bit heavy in the mouth, but finishes clean and lemony.
title: La Villa Veneta 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: While there's a decent amount of weight to this wine—enough to stand up to food—the flavors seem a bit dilute, showing only hints of almond and melon.
title: Lagaria 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: The color is very light, and so are the flavors. Although it lacks intensity, this faintly lemony wine is crisp, clean and moderately refreshing.
title: Torresella 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Partly fermented and aged in 500-liter French barrels, this opens with aromas of toasted oak, bread crust, acacia and sage. The rounded medium-boded palate offers mature yellow-apple skin, pineapple and a hint of butterscotch while a nutty note closes the finish.
title: Lis Neris 2015 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: This is a great sunny day wine, starting with aromas of honeydew melon, ripe nectarine and lemongrass. There is a slightly peachy, bubblegum character once sipped, with lemon-lime soda in the midpalate and a flinty, gunmetal finish.
title: Bargetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

description: This oak-aged expression of Pinot Grigio is compelling and outstanding. The wine opens with ripe aromas of papaya and apricot with slight touches of vanilla and lemon cream. The rich mouthfeel would match hearty clam chowder or lobster.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2009 Sot Lis Rivis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: This plush, rich expression of Pinot Grigio from northeast Italy would pair with white meat, seafood risotto or spicy dishes from the Far East. The mouthfeel is smooth, rich and long-lasting.
title: Lis Neris 2008 Gris Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: Bright and refreshing, this easygoing white offers delicate aromas and flavors of white spring flower, Granny Smith apple and citrus. Racy acidity gives it a crisp finish.
title: La Vis 2014 Simboli Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Aromas of apple, citrus, hay and a whiff of medicinal herb carry over to rather lean palate along with a note of bitter almond. Racy acidity gives it a brisk finish.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This is dryish, impeccably clean and brisk in mouthwatering acidity, with layers of citrus and tropical fruits, apples, vanilla, honey and white pepper. It's a delight to drink by itself, or with everything from Vietnamese to Mexican cuisine. Production was 15,000 cases.
title: Pepi 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Crisp, citrusy acidity gives a sense of balance to the honey-sweet lime, lemon and pear flavors. It's an easy wine to drink now.
title: Middle Sister NV Drama Queen Pinot Grigio (California)

description: There's a distinctive herbal and mineral linearity to this white that is accented by tones of kiwi and passion fruit. Offers a sharp point of spicy acidity and just enough structure to broaden its appeal in the mouth. Closed with a glass cork.
title: Plozner 2006 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This pleasant fruit cocktail of a wine smells like pears and peaches and tastes equally fruity, ripe and smooth. It's medium bodied and soft in texture, yet fresh and clean on the finish.
title: Gnarly Head 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: It tastes lean and refreshing, with light lemon and green apple in the aroma and flavors, rather light body and a slightly tangy finish. It makes a nice change from the often too-heavy or too-sweet whites in this price range.
title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is one of those luminous Pinot Grigios that sits well in the mouth and satisfies on all fronts. The wine is redolent of exotic fruit and citrus but has the creamy density to match shellfish or prawns.
title: Masottina 2008 Vigneto ai Palazzi Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: This is the perfect wine for washing down pasta salad and easy dishes. Peach, citrus and pink grapefruit are delivered in measured doses and the wine is light and lean in the mouth with a brilliant sparkle of acidity on the close.
title: Ecco Domani 2006 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Light floral and green apple aromas and ripe apple and peach flavors make this wine tasty and easy to like. It's medium-bodied and soft on the finish.
title: Three Thieves 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Brief skin contact during fermentation gives this appropriately named, single-vineyard (The Benches) rosé it's pretty pale-salmon color. It's immediately appealing, with notes of melon and strawberry, and just a hair off-dry, with a rich, textured feel.
title: Julia's Dazzle 2012 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Fermented and aged in large Slavonian oak, this unusual, copper-colored wine opens with scents of wildflower, red berry, baking spice and a balsamic note. The spicy palate is linear and structured, showing ginger, cinnamon, tangerine zest and mineral but not much fruit richness. A white pepper note closes the finish.
title: La Castellada 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: You'll find aromas of beeswax, white flower and a whiff of orchard fruit on this fragrant white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine, toasted almond and mineral alongside bracing acidity.
title: Livon 2014 Braide Grande Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and a confectionary note lead the nose while the palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, butterscotch and walnut skin alongside bracing acidity.
title: Marco Felluga 2012 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This bright, fragrant wine offers aromas of an orchard in bloom, spring flower, peach and a hint of banana. The crisp palate shows crunchy apple, pear and mineral alongside bracing acidity. A light almond note signals the crisp close.
title: Sturm 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Made in the easy, crisp and affordable style that has made this variety so popular, this Pinot Grigio has fruity flavors of peaches, apricots, apples, pineapples, tangerines and vanilla, with a spicy, honeyed finish.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Inviting aromas of toasted almond, pear and a whiff of chopped herb lead the nose on this linear white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine zest and flinty mineral accompanied by bright acidity.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Showing copper reflections, this vibrant wine offers enticing scents of white wildflower and orchard fruit. The savory palate presents poached Bartlett pear, nectarine zest and a mineral note accompanied by firm acidity.
title: Venica & Venica 2014 Jesera Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and a confectionary note lead the nose while the palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, butterscotch and walnut skin alongside bracing acidity.
title: Marco Felluga 2012 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Oak, yellow apple and butterscotch aromas open on the nose. The structured palate offers toast, mineral, oak-driven spice and a confectionary note but it's shy on fruit richness. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fresh and fruity, this lively white offers aromas and flavors of green Anjou pear, Granny Smith apple and white peach. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp, tangy finish.
title: La Vis 2014 Ritratti Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: The nose of this lively white is a combination of delicate aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit while the bright palate offers tart Granny Smith apple, tangerine and a hint of crushed stone. Vibrant acidity carries through to the crisp finish.
title: Nals Margreid 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Delicate but alluring scents of spring flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The palate is linear and rather lean but still refreshing, offering pear, yellow apple and mineral alongside bracing acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
title: St. Pauls 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Fresh and lively, this opens with aromas of jasmine, tropical fruit and a whiff of flint. The vibrant palate offers crunchy Granny Smith and candied lemon alongside brisk acidity. A mineral note energizes the crisp finish.
title: Tenuta di Angoris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: The color of light straw, this wine offers a clean aroma of ripe pineapple. It is soft in the mouth, with a flavor of slightly tart lemon curd and a hint of lemon blossom.
title: Puklavec & Friends 2013 Pinot Grigio (Štajerska)

description: A fresh, ripe style of wine, with spice and roundness. It has crisp citrus flavors to give it a lively aftertaste.
title: Borgo Conventi 2002 I Fiori del Borgo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: A full-bodied, rounded wine with some good crisp acidity to balance. It has flavors of pears and some spice, leaving an attractive fresh feel in the mouth.
title: Cantina Tramin 2002 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Clean, crisp and fresh, which is enough to satisfy most Pinot Grigio drinkers. This one blends Asian pear with hints of green herbs and lemon to make a refreshing summertime quaff.
title: Foffani 2000 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Swanson does a good job of crafting a dry, crisp, mouthwatering Pinot Grigio with little or no oak influence. The acidity is juicy, making the apple, citrus and wildflower flavors savory. Good white with today's wide range of ethnic fare.
title: Swanson 2007 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: With vibrant aromas of green apple and lemon, this seemingly delicate Pinot Grigio turns out surprisingly brawny and bold. Apple and pear flavors are fresh on the palate, finishing moderately long with a hint of alcoholic warmth and a lingering bitter-almond note.
title: Damiani 2013 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: Light aromas like canned fruit cocktail and almost sweet flavors like banana and marshmallow characterize this medium-bodied wine.
title: Peltier 2014 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: This is a unique wine indeed. The style here is heavy, thick and shows the limits Pinot Grigio can achieve in terms of extraction and richness. The wine's appearance shows a copperish hue and the texture is thickly laced with carmel, candied fruit and apricot.
title: Antonutti 2010 Vis Terrae Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Pinot Grigio Posto Bello (“pretty place”) has a high mineral content that recalls crushed stone and slate. Beyond those drying tones are fruity notes of citrus, pear, peach and a distinctive herbal component. The wine ends with sweet fruit flavors.
title: Posto Bello 2007 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Here's an easygoing Pinot Grigio with attractive tones of lemon zest, white flower and crushed stone. The wine is lean and mild in the mouth with enough zest and natural acidity to pair with fried sardines.
title: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2008 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Tommasi presents a light and informal Pinot Grigio that would wash down beautifully with salad, grilled vegetables, fish or chicken. Fragrances here include ripe peach and honey and the wine offers a playful touch of sweetness in the mouth.
title: Tommasi 2008 Vigneto Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Here's a fresh and floral wine with an easy disposition and vibrant aromas of citrus and spring flowers. The body is light and lean—as informal Pinot Grigio should be—and the wine ends with a zesty blast of acidity. We like this vintage much more than 2006.
title: Bivio 2007 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fruity and off-dry, with jammy lemon, lime, pineapple and honey flavors. With no oak, the fruit stars in this crisp wine, which contains a drop of Sauvignon Blanc and Gewürztraminer.
title: Geyser Peak 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Richness and fruitiness combine in this medium-bodied, uncomplicated wine. It brings fresh citrus and pear aromas, ample apple and pear flavors, a smooth texture and a clean finish.
title: Stomping Ground 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This lively Pinot Grigio from northern Italy has green apple, ripe pear and citrus sensations alongside fresh acidity. Sip as an apéritif or pair it with summer salads.
title: La Vis 2013 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This is easy to drink, with crisp, mouthwatering acidity that brightens the lemon, lime and tropical fruit flavors. It's slightly sweet, but not overtly so—just enough to pair with Asian-inspired fare.
title: Butterfly Kiss 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A soft mouthfeel and fresh golden delicious apple flavors make this light-bodied wine easy on the palate. It has crisp and clean flavors all the way through.
title: The Naked Grape NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's an Italian-styled Pinot Grigio, with a gently nutty nose and earthy low notes. It's faintly oily in the mouth but finishes crisp and light, with a pretty lemon zest accent. Drink up.
title: Redbank 2008 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: A bizarre blend of lime, unipe pineapple, banana and tropical fruit marks this clumsy, disjointed wine. It's not bad, but it's all elbows, with hard edges sticking out all over.
title: San Giuseppe 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Like rose gold in a glass, this skin-fermented Pinot Gris glimmers with complexity. Aged in a combination of French and Slovenian oak, it's lavishly aromatic, penetrating the palate with tones of potpourri and spice, citrus rind and smoked tea leaves. Tart tangerine acidity lends vibe and refreshment through a long, long finish.
title: Channing Daughters 2012 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

description: Here's a fun and fresh Italian Pinot Grigio with piquant aromas of citrus and peach. The wine is informal and easy-drinking. A good food pairing would be chicken salad or lightly roasted fish. Screwcap.
title: La Villa 2008 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Marked by brisk, citrusy acidity, this Pinot Grigio has orange, Meyer lemon and sweet green-grass flavors. It would pair well with Chinese and Vietnamese food.
title: Swanson 2011 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Lemon zest, citrus blossoms and peach aromas lead the way to tropical fruit flavors in this Romanian Pinot Grigio. It is light bodied with a crisp finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: There's a nice weight and intensity to this wine, especially for a grape that is often deemed innocuous and light. Apple and pear skin tones offer tension to the fuzzy-textured palate, with a vein of citrus keeping everything in focus.
title: 2 Lads 2013 Pinot Grigio (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: Citrus blossom and peach aromas open while the zesty palate offers rennet apple, lemon drop and almond. Crisp acidity and a mineral note lead to a tangy finish.
title: Ascevi Luwa 2014 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: White spring flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose. The lively, straightforward palate shows peach and a hint of bitter almond accompanied by brisk acidity.
title: Bortoluzzi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Partially fermented in barriques (20%), this opens with aromas of oak, toasted nut and a whiff of vanilla. The palate offers yellow apple, bitter almond, peach and a hint of tangerine accompanied by lively acidity.
title: Cantina Cortaccia 2014 Penoner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This vibrant Pinot Grigio offers delicate scents of white flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. The crisp palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple, green pear and tangerine while bracing acidity gives it a clean finish.
title: Collavini 2014 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Seems like its best days are behind it. That said, there's still some fire in the hole and kick to this South American PG. Pineapple is the lead aroma and flavor, with pink grapefruit and passion fruit sitting in reserve. Has flow but is starting to fall apart.
title: Tango Sur 2006 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This is an aromatic offering of Pinot Grigio with generous notes of freshly cut red and green apple along with pear. Medium bodied, it drinks just a touch off dry with mouthwatering acidity and a real sense of freshness.
title: Sockeye 2011 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fragrant in fruity melon, fig and lime, La Folia's done a nice job with this Pinot Grigio, producing something that's crisp yet full, integrated, round and lush yet zippy in acidity. Pair with pasta, salads and veggies of all kinds.
title: La Folia Winery 2012 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

description: Floral and stony in minerality, this is a delightful affordable quaff that's waxy in peach and apricot. Fleshy and lushly soft, it should please a wide range of palates in its easygoing approachability.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2016 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: Pinot Grigio grape berries aren't actually gray; instead they are tinged with pink or purple. Maybe it is just the power of suggestion, but this wine even seems to taste pink, showcasing ripe berries and apples that are backed by tangy acids and great length. Classy stuff.
title: Livio Felluga 2002 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

description: This relatively full-bodied Pinot Grigio leans toward warm, baked-apple scents and flavors, blending ripe fruit with dried cinnamon and folding in hints of peach on the long finish. Has a lovely, caressing mouthfeel that underscores its comforting flavors.
title: Jermann 2001 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: There's a slight coppery tinge to this wine's color, which sets it apart from the vast majority of other Grigios on the market. And maybe it's just the suggestion of the hue, but it seems to taste "pink" as well, showcasing ripe berries and appples backed by tangy acids and great length. Classy stuff.
title: Livio Felluga 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

description: At the time of tasting, this wine was slightly sparkling, providing a pleasant tingle to the lemon, lime and yeast flavors.
title: Bargetto 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Light in color and lean in consistency, this offers subtle aromas of citrus, honey and grapefruit. The wine is refreshing and crisp overall.
title: Straccali 2011 Pinot Grigio (Provincia di Pavia)

description: A highly drinkable wine that's very well put together, this is redolent of citrus, stone fruit and crushed mineral.
title: Livio Felluga 2011 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: A good Pinot Grigio if you're looking for something off-dry. It's crisp in acidity, with sugary orange, pear and lime flavors. Easy to drink with Vietnamese, Thai, Ethiopian, Indian or other such ethnic fare based on chicken or lamb.
title: Arrow Creek 2011 Coastal Series Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This well-priced, light-bodied Pinot Grigio provides flavors of stone fruit—mostly apricot—with a tiny trace of petrol. It would make a fine apéritif, particularly alongside oysters or shrimp.
title: Villa Toscano 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's an easy-drinking (and well-priced) Pinot Grigio with little extraction and simple aromas of citrus and white peach. The wine is watery and thin in the mouth but it does offer that trademark touch of acidity on the close.
title: Mariana 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Here's a watery and thinly extracted Pinot Grigio that delivers measured aromas of citrus, honey and passion fruit. This is the kind of easygoing wine you'll want to share at park picnics.
title: Don Giovanni 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Simple and sweet, with Lifesaver candy flavors of pineapples and lemons. Earns an extra point for the clean mouthfeel.
title: Arrow Creek 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a sweet, softly simple wine whose apricot, citrus and peach flavors will satisfy those looking for a decent everyday white wine.
title: McManis 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Another fantastic bargain wine from Cramele Recas, the Dreambird is a delightfully fresh, floral Pinot Grigio that's zesty with lemon and just a hint of steely minerality on the finish. Bright, clean and refreshingly easy quaffing.
title: Cramele Recas 2012 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

description: Dull and dilute, but painless. The palate is chunky but with enough acids to stay lively, and the flavors of green apple, lemon and pineapple are decent enough. Tangy and slightly bitter on the finish.
title: Graffigna 2009 Centenario Reserve Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

description: Actress Drew Barrymore's project with Carmel Road shows aromas of sliced golden and red apples, wet cement and freshly cut grass. It's slightly salty on the palate with a tremendous amount of apple cider-like zing that runs through the whole sipping experience, showing both the floral and bitter flavors of ruby-red grapefruit pith.
title: Barrymore 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: This Grigio opens with mild lemon and apple aromas that transition into a flabby palate and dull flavors of buttercup, banana and apple.
title: Trapiche 2011 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Light floral aromas and more rich and savory flavors make this wine satisfying to drink. It's light-bodied, fairly soft in texture and has a light sugary finish.
title: Geyser Peak 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's an easy but powerful Grigio with aromas of cut grass and exotic fruit. The wine has good structure and weight suggesting a pairing with fish, risotto or a Greek salad.
title: Valchiarò 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Fresh, easy and a bit watery overall, this Pinot Grigio offers simple aromas of citrus, grapefruit with subtle shadings of crushed white stone. It ends on a simple, dry note.
title: Cabert 2007 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: The touch of pink in the light gold color is natural for a Pinot Grigio, reflecting the color of the grape skins. This has light white cherry aromas, pear flavors and a crisp hint of lemon that brings a tangy touch.
title: The White Knight 2014 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine with sharp acidity that balances ripe flavors of citrus, tropical fruits, peaches, honeysuckle and vanilla bean. It finishes a little off-dry.
title: Terlato 2012 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: A slightly tawny or pink color, characteristic of this variety's grape skins, helps this wine stand out. Aromas like ripe pears and apples lead to vivid, tangy apple and apricot flavors and rather light body.
title: Mirassou 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Pinot Grigio Bella Donna is distinguished by a drying mineral note that comes on the heels of fresh citrus, stone fruit, spring flowers and white peppercorn. The wine is simple and clean with fresh acidity and an easy ability to pair with fried shrimp or calamari.
title: Bella Donna 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: White spring flower, Bosc pear and wet stone aromas lift out of the glass. The bright, straightforward palate offers apple, tangerine and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity.
title: Albino Armani 2014 Corvara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: It offers linear apple, pear and juicy white fruit flavors alongside a subtle smoky note. Crisp acidity leaves a refreshing finish.
title: Tommasi 2012 Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

description: Subtle aromas of smoke, Bartlett pear and Granny Smith apple carry over to the palate along with a citrusy note and a hint of raw almond.
title: Peter Zemmer 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This wine tastes very tangy and crisp. Medium bodied, with lemon and green-apple flavors, it's refreshing and mouth-cleansing.
title: Archgate Cellars 2015 Reserve Bottling Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Light straw in the glass, this wine offers green herbal aromas on the nose, complemented by floral notes and a whiff of sandalwood. Its green apple flavors and strong minerality make for an enjoyable quaff.
title: Giocato 2014 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

description: Floral notes of honeysuckle and acacia ride on the heels of peach and nectarine. This is a simple white wine with good freshness and a lean, watery feel in the mouth.
title: Principi di Porcìa 2008 Ca' Bembo Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Lightweight and thin in the mouth, this zesty white wine does a good job of keeping your palate refreshed and quenches your thirst (think hot summer day). It's an easy and informal wine that stays focused on simplicity.
title: Pighin 2008 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This creamy Pinot Grigio from Northeast Italy delivers thick aromas of mature melon, peach and honeysuckle. The wine offers breadth and width in the mouth thanks to its naturally rich consistency.
title: Teresa Raiz 2008 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Here's a pretty and bright Pinot Grigio with sensations of green apple and pear. This is simple but well made, and while it makes a refreshing apéritif, it will also pair nicely with pasta al pomodoro or lightly seasoned fish dishes.
title: Canaletto 2012 Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

description: This affordable, straightforward white wine is fresh and crisp, buoyed up with tart acids and flavors of citrus rind, pears, and green apples. It has a bit more concentration than its budget-priced Washington competitors, and the vibrant, clean fruit flavors match well with a wide variety of summer dishes.
title: Hogue 2007 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: More Pinot Grigios should taste like this. A rich pear-like nose is followed by crisp acidity, a medium body and a viscous mouthfeel. The finish is long and redolent of pears and citrus. And all for $15!
title: Alois Lageder 1999 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Opening aromas of wildflowers and pears lead to a subtle palate offering tart green apple, juicy nectarine and Barltett pear alongside crisp acidity. Pair this with appetizers and light first courses or sip as an apéritif.
title: La Tunella 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: With some Pinot Blanc blended in for richness, this wine has a honeyed edge to the lemon, pineapple and pear fruit flavors. It's crisp with Monterey acidity.
title: Pinot Patch 2012 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

description: The aromas are subtle, but the palate is more expressive, with green apple, white peach and lemon zest taking the lead. Crisp acidity gives this a clean, refreshing finish. Sip as an apéritif or enjoy it with starters and lightly seasoned pasta dishes.
title: Livio Felluga 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Intensely concentrated and nuanced with oak, spice and citrus rind, there's a whole lot more than insipid quaffing in store for this Pinot Grigio. Lithe, lean and deeply mineral in style, it's a wine meant for slow sipping and pondering.
title: Channing Daughters 2013 Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

description: A nice bite of acidity gives this fruity Pinot Grigio a clean finish. It's marked by savory flavors of lemons, limes, grapefruits and orange honey.
title: Toccata 2010 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Packaged in a cheerful bright blue bottle, this offers simple aromas of wild flower, cut grass and citrus. It's a simple, fresh white, with a bright finish of melon and peach.
title: Piera Martellozzo 2010 Blu Giovello Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: For the price this is a nice party wine. It's sweet, offering ripe citrus and vanilla flavors. Production was 5,400 cases.
title: Discoveries 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Flavors of stone fruit, citrus and crushed mineral mark the simple, refreshing mouthfeel. This is a good choice for a hot summer afternoon.
title: Paladin 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This opens with aromas of chamomile flower and ripe Bartlett pear. The lively easy-drinking palate offers green apple, white peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.
title: Andriano 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Lime and green apples on the nose, with a floral note as well. It's medium-bodied, featuring a sharp, citrusy edge to the finish.
title: Bella Sera 2002 Tre Venezie Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Boasts some interesting flavors of graphite or slate, and mineral oil, which complement its pear and kumquat aromas. Could use more focus and length, but certainly pleasant; chilling it well will make it seem firmer.
title: Bolla 2001 Arcale Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: An odd style that may not appeal to everyone, with apple and pineapple flavors marked by butter and vanilla. It's medium bodied, and picks up a hint of lemon on the finish.
title: Ecco Domani 2001 Maso Canali Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Though not labeled as such, this is a single-vineyard offering from Pontin del Roza Vineyard. It brings notes of apple and apricot, drinking dry with a quite elegant yet flavorful styling.
title: Wind Rose 2013 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

description: This is a fabulous, copper-hued Pinot Grigio with a creamy, thick consistency and gorgeous aromas of honeysuckle, almond and stone fruit. It's slightly sweet and chewy in the mouth with mouthwatering acidity on the close.
title: Cantarutti 2006 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Pinot Grigio Unterebner offers a beautiful contrast between cool-climate aromas of white flower and passion fruit and spicy, oak-driven aromas of vanilla and cinnamon bun. Pair this wine with a savory appetizer strudel filled with spinach, cheese and pine nuts.
title: Tramin 2010 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Elena Walch produces one of the finest Pinot Grigios available (aged 25% percent in oak and the rest in stainless steel) with citrus, peach and almond paste aromas. The wine stands out both for the quality and the intensity of its beautiful bouquet.
title: Elena Walch 2010 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Dried lime rinds, wet cement, pear blossoms, honeydew melon and tangerine show on the nose of this bottling that is ever-so-slightly pink in the glass. Honeysuckle flavors meet with ripe pear and apple on the palate that is a tad sweet.
title: Noble Vines 2015 152 Pinot Grigio (San Bernabe)

description: A blend of Pinot Grigio with a small percentage of Pinot Bianco that was aged in wood. The result is a full wine with aromas of white flowers, opulent and spicy on the palate, and leaving crisp acidity in the mouth.
title: Produttori Colterenzio 2001 Cornell Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: The wine is quiet at first, but with patience, some red apple and pear skin shine through. The flavors surround yellow fruits, between citrus and melon, presented with a bright, nearly biting acidity.
title: Avelina 2012 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Easy, toned and fresh, this opens with citrus, peach and honey aromas. The mouthfeel is lean, sharp and brightly acidic.
title: Tiamo 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: A great value wine, this opens with fresh, easy aromas of citrus, melon and dried hay. It has good depth and a smooth texture.
title: Villa Rubini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: A popular restaurant choice, Santa Margherita epitomizes the light, breezy style that has made Pinot Grigio an American sweetheart. Aromas include peach, citrus, honey and pear. The wine is crisp and clean in the mouth with very friendly alcohol at an approachable 12%.
title: Santa Margherita 2008 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Bollini Pinot Grigio offers satisfying sensations of crisp lemon, stone fruit and melon. The wine is slightly sweet in the mouth and fills in the rear with pretty floral and fruit flavors. Pair it with finger foods and appetizers. With almost 200,000 cases made, this wine should be easy to locate.
title: Bollini 2008 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This is a rich and well-concentrated Pinot Grigio that feels great in the mouth. On the nose an otherwise pristine bouquet is accented by apricot, honey, Golden Delicious apple and pear.
title: Marco Felluga 2008 Mongris Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: An extremely pale color and light fruit salad aromas are followed by fresh, gentle texture and banana and cherry flavors. Light in alcohol, delicate in mouthfeel and short on the finish, it's a mere wisp of a wine.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: This copper-colored wine, the result of extended contact between the just-pressed juice and the grape skins, opens with pretty aromas of wildflower, stone fruit and an herbal note. The savory palate delivers juicy apple, peach, pink grapefruit and a mineral accent alongside zesty acidity.
title: Attems 2013 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: This inexpensive white wine does a good job of being dry and ultracrisp in acidity, which gets the mouth watering. It offers pleasant flavors of Lifesaver candy pineapples and lemons, with a hint of vanilla.
title: Tamás 2008 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: This white starts by presenting aromas of orchard fruit, pressed yellow flower and toasted almond. The bright palate offers white peach and crisp pear alongside the bracing acidity that characterizes this vintage.
title: La Rajade 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This opens with hushed aromas that recall pressed white flower and orchard fruit. The rather lean palate shows raw yellow peach and a touch of acacia honey alongside bracing acidity. A note of bitter almond and a hint of mineral mark the finish.
title: Livio Felluga 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This rather deeply hued, yellow-gold wine offers aromas suggesting orchard fruit, toasted almond and crushed rock. The palate shows tart apple and green pear accompanied by vibrant acidity.
title: Marco Scolaris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose on this lively white. The fresh, easy-drinking palate offers ripe green apple, peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.
title: Alta Luna 2015 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Smooth and appealing, with ample fresh citrus flavors and a supple mouthfeel, this isn't so assertive that it gets in the way of the conversation or the food. Sourcing good quality grapes from non-premier regions keeps the price down.
title: Cookies & Cream 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Pungent jasmine and orange blossom take hold of the nose right away, ensuring that this won't be one of those flavorless Pinot Grigios to forget. On the palate, roasted pear and slight toffee tones mingle with lemon-lime acidity, making this wine a nice fit for backyard gatherings featuring shrimp on the barbie.
title: Castle Rock 2012 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

description: Fruity and slightly herbal aromas and flavors give a tasty character to this light-bodied and slightly sweet wine. It has an agreeable, uncomplicated fruitiness and a soft texture.
title: Domino 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: White spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of Alpine herb come together on this delicious, structured white. The juicy, full-bodied palate offers white peach, mature pear and tangerine alongside bright acidity that lifts the creamy flavors. A precise mineral note closes the lingering finish and lends finesse.
title: Elena Walch 2015 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: The color here is a deeper shade of gold and the fragrant aromas are characteristic of a well-made, concentrated Pinot Grigio: honey, peach and Golden Delicious apple ride over a creamy, supple mouthfeel. Fresh flavors include caramel and peach.
title: Pighin 2006 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Rich texture and concentration are layered with aromas of stone fruit, toasted nut and a distinctive herbal accent. This is a vibrant, golden wine with a round, silky essence and attractive crispness.
title: Pighin 2006 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This Pinot Grigio from a new producer in the cool Adelaide Hills starts off a little herbal—almost minty—then delivers a full-bodied, weighty palate experience. The flavors are fairly neutral, making it more about flesh and weight than well delineated flavors, but that should help make it more versatile with food. Drink now. Imported by Tom Eddy Wines.
title: The Lane 2004 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

description: This is textbook Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie—meaning that fruit is sourced from anywhere within the region—with characteristic aromas of Golden Delicious apple, pear, natural rubber, yellow fruit, honey and a playful touch of citrus zest. Broad dimension and a spicy finish call for a dish like sweet and sour pork.
title: Tommasi 2006 Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: In a return to tradition, some enterprising Pinot Grigio producers allow more skin contact during winemaking, which results in a slightly copper-colored wine (as the name implies, Pinot Grigio's natural skin color is copper-gray). This is one of those wines and besides the unique color, you'll appreciate its aromas of peach, citrus, almond and natural rubber.
title: Girlan 2006 AltoPiano Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: An aromatically pleasing wine with notes of pear, apple and petroleum jelly. It's almost frizzante in feel and drinks dry with just a touch of residual sugar (3.6 g/L) sweetening the finish.
title: Sockeye 2012 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of ripe apple, sliced pear and white flowers lead to tart, lighter-side-of-medium-bodied fruit flavors. Spices notes fill out the finish. It delivers easy-drinking enjoyment and is very varietal.
title: Bieler Family 2016 Daisy Pinot Grigio (Washington)

description: This light-bodied wine smells like honeydew melon and canteloupe and tastes almost sweet. The texture falls between bright and rich.
title: Oak Grove 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas of banana, wisteria and green pear lead the nose on this refreshing white. The bright, juicy palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity.
title: Cembra 2013 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Bright and savory, this opens with pretty aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The vibrant palate offers crisp green apple and white peach set in a framework of zesty acidity. Sip as a refreshing apéritif or pair it with light first courses.
title: Alta Luna 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Here's a Pinot Grigio with structure and personality, proving why Friuli is Italy's white wine capital. It's loaded with creamy green apple and pear sensations uplifted by energizing mineral notes. The finish is crisp and clean.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2011 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Ronco dei Vignali opens with exotic fruit, fragrant nectarine, papaya and lemongrass on the finish. The bouquet is very beautiful and the mouthfeel is tame and understated in comparison.
title: Ascevi Luwa 2011 Ronco dei Vignali Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Aromas of banana, wisteria and green pear lead the nose on this refreshing white. The bright, juicy palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity.
title: Cembra 2013 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This is an intense, oaky and savory mix of ripeness and power. Although the fruit is muted and understated, the wine is full bodied in style and weight.
title: Benessere 2014 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Medium in weight, with modest pear and melon aromas and flavors. It's clean and fresh, finishing with a delicate touch of citrus. Drink now.
title: De Bortoli 2010 DB Family Selection Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: Full and generous, this has creamy peach and apricot aromas backed by a slightly spicy touch of vanilla bean and caramel. Pair this wine with coconut curry.
title: Riondo 2011 Monte Forte Lot 6 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Bright citrus and bitter almond give this a sharp, tonic personality. Pair this easy, food-friendly wine with sushi or Thai food.
title: Tenuta Polvaro 2010 Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

description: This casual wine shows aromas of lemon soda, cut grass and ripe peach. The mouthful is simple and fresh.
title: Natale Verga 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Simple, broad and slightly oily at first, this has generous melon and apricot aromas. There is enough natural acidity to brighten the palate.
title: Paladin 2010 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This wine opens with aromas of toasted oak, butterscotch and vanilla. The palate delivers toast, oak extract and mineral, but it lacks fruit richness to fully balance the dominant wood. It ends on a bitter coffee bean note.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2011 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is a value white, with fresh tones of citrus, pear and stone fruit. Zesty crispness marks the finish, making it perfect for smoked salmon with cream cheese.
title: Altùris 2011 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: An admirable effort, combining lemony citrus notes with hints of pear and quince. It's medium in body, with a long, crisp finish.
title: Redbank 2014 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: This light-bodied wine brings enjoyment at a very low price. Attractive grapefruit and dried herb aromas followed by citrus and savory flavors make it appetizing and enjoyable. It tastes dry, fairly crisp and well balanced.
title: CK Mondavi 2014 Willow Springs Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Reductive on first pour, this wine opens to display aromas of freshly sliced red apple and melon. It drinks a hair off dry, with a fleshy, full feel.
