description: This full-bodied Pinot Grigio offers aromas of sunbaked soil, hay, mature apple and dried herb. The rounded palate offers yellow apple and orange zest alongside soft acidity while a light mineral note lifts the finish.
title: Alessio Komjanc 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Pizzolato brings us an easygoing Pinot Grigio with a thin, watery mouthfeel and measured aromas of citrus, white mineral and passion fruit. This informal style of wine works well at outdoor lunches and barbecues.
title: Pizzolato 2008 Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: A nose with apples, vanilla and pear, and flavors of flowers and pears are found in this delicate Pinot Grigio. Spicy but floral, with a quaffable character.
title: Cramele Recas 2008 Alb Sec Pinot Grigio (Viile Timis)

description: Compact and lean, this no-fuss Pinot Grigio offers little in terms of density or intensity. It is, however, a fresh and easy wine that works well on informal occasions.
title: Moletto 2007 Pinot Grigio (Veneto Orientale)

description: Here's an easygoing Pinot Grigio that does a good job at keeping your palate refreshed. The structure is thin and watery and the wine offers aromas of peach, pear and white flower. But the acidity is there and that's what you need for salads and appetizers. Good price tag too.
title: Pizzolato 2007 Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: A wonderful Pinot Grigio that's basically dry and mouthwateringly crisp in acidity, with lemon and lime flavors.
title: Black Box 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This inexpensive wine is relatively low in alcohol and reasonably refreshing, although pear, melon and pineapple flavors leave a slightly sweet impression on the palate. Drink now.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: Pretty decent for a 10-spot, with slightly floral aromas, a hint of ginger and underripe pear fruit. It's medium bodied, with a dry, lightly textured, bitter finish. Drink now.
title: Oxford Landing 2016 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

description: This structured wine has subtle aromas of apples, vanilla and toasted notes. These carry over to the linear palate together with pear, mineral, lemon zest and lively acidity. Pair it with baked pasta dishes or grilled chicken.
title: Mezzacorona 2012 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This full-bodied Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of tropical fruit, melon and stone fruit. The concentrated palate delvers yellow peach, mature pear and juicy pineapple alongside notes of aromatic herbs.
title: Cantina Terlano 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Easy, fresh and buoyant, this luminous Pinot Grigio offers pretty aromas of citrus, pear and white mineral. The wine tastes fresh and easygoing and offers a clean, zesty feel on the close. Pair it with tomato and basil bruschetta.
title: Fontana d'Italia 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Here's a creamy expression of Pinot Grigio with a saturated, golden color and dense aromas of cantaloupe, apricot, almond and yellow rose. The wine is rich and textured in the mouth with a dense, long-lasting finish and a slightly sour aftertaste.
title: Teresa Raiz 2008 Vigneti Le Marsure Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Executed in a ramato style (with a copperish color), this oak-aged Pinot Grigio offers aromas of white cherry and cranberry followed by rose and candied lemon. Crisp acidity helps break apart the wine's creamy texture.
title: Bonotto delle Tezze 2009 Montesanto Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: From a Lovall Valley location, this light white is intense in pear and peach, with a nuttiness to the strong, viscous foundation of oak. It finishes crisply like a twist of lime.
title: Muscardini 2014 Ansa di Loval Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Napa County)

description: Aromas of white flowers and ripe banana lead the way to flavors of tart green apple and melon. The finish is pleasant but slightly acidic.
title: Avia 2014 Hand Harvested Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

description: This is a terrific and youthful white wine for those looking for an easy pairing companion to Chinese take-out or fresh garden salads. It offers a fragrant bouquet of pear, citrus and white flower.
title: La Viarte 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A little on the sugary sweet side, but the apricot and tangerine jam flavors are brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Motos Liberty 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Dry yet lusciously mouth filling, this is subtly floral, with a hefty dose of fresh apple flavor. It's straightforward but pleasantly quaffable. Drink now.
title: Goose Watch 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: Cool, crisp and tonic from start to finish, this is an easy-drinking wine with ample sweet apple and wildflower notes, with shades of smoke, hazelnut skins and delicate lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
title: Belhurst 2010 Pinot Grigio (New York)

description: Rick Longoria shows increasing mastery over this popular variety, lifting it into true complexity. After an outstanding 2010 vintage, his 2011 is even better, showing the same crisp acidity and savory orange, apricot and honey flavors, but with even greater elegance.
title: Longoria 2011 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Slight apple aromas are found on this fading Pinot Gris that's feeling flat and syrupy. Melon and pear flavors are a touch bitter on the finish.
title: Inacayal 2014 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: One of the flagship wineries of Italy's Veneto region, Zenato offers sophisticated reds (like Amarone) and easy-drinking whites like this fresh Pinot Grigio. It show creamy richness, bright acidity and lively notes of lemon, pear and peach.
title: Zenato 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Crisp and pungent, this has penetrating aromas of cut apple. Flavors resemble fresh, unfermented apple cider. There's a touch of bitterness in the finish.
title: Apolloni 2016 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

description: A lovely wine to have at picnics, on the beach, backyard barbecues, even at the table with everything from fried calamari and goat cheese to roast pork and fresh fruit. Completely dry and racy in acids, it shows intense, nervy flavors of citrus fruits and zest, with spicy notes of medjool dates.
title: Mirassou 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas of tropical fruit, pear and honeysuckle jump out of the glass. The straightforward palate delivers tart green apple, white peach and a touch of citrus alongside bright acidity.
title: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2013 Superiore Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Aromas of beeswax, acacia and honeysuckle lead the nose. The palate offers honey, mature yellow apple and citrus alongside racy acidity.
title: Masut da Rive 2013 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

description: Made with a little Gewürztraminer, this pretty white wine has citrus, floral, peach, apricot, vanilla and spice flavors, offset with crisp acidity. It's a nice wine for drinking as a cocktail or with passed around hors d'oeuvres.
title: Château Julien 2010 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

description: A lightly herbaceous aroma and bright citrus flavors make this light-bodied wine fresh and easy to drink. It smells like fresh-cut grass and lemon, tastes like grapefruit and honeydew melon, and feels soft and smooth.
title: Pepi 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A musky perfume note is sultry and exotic in this rich, textured Pinot Grigio, which was fermented on its skins and matured in oak. The fruity palate offers penetrating dried-pear, nut oil and apple flavors, which are layered with citrusy acids and soft, tea-leaf-like tannins that linger on the finish.
title: Channing Daughters 2011 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

description: With a sweet finish, this easy white wine has ripe flavors of oranges and limes. Brisk acidity helps keep the finish clean and zippy.
title: Delicato 2011 Domino Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This inexpensive wine is relatively low in alcohol and reasonably refreshing, although pear, melon and pineapple flavors leave a slightly sweet impression on the palate. Drink now.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: Nicely rounded in texture without being flabby, this is a lively, crisp white wine, well endowed with flavors reminiscent of melon, pear and lime. Perfect to drink now with most seafood dishes, or as an apéritif.
title: Zonte's Footstep 2010 Doctoressa di Lago Single Site Pinot Grigio (Fleurieu Peninsula)

description: Interesting and well structured, this can age a few years or more. Aromas of honey, stone fruit and butterscotch candy give this wine a sophisticated edge.
title: Villa Russiz 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Here's a savory Pinot Grigio that's loaded with character, offering inviting aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. The round, medium-bodied palate has just enough weight, doling out ripe Bartlett pear, creamy yellow apple and a hint of juicy tangerine while an energizing mineral note closes the finish.
title: Terlan 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Borgo Conventi (owned by Tuscany's Ruffino) brings us a creamy Pinot Grigio with rich nuances of citrus and passion fruits, mango and pineapple. The wine is perfectly round and proportionate in the mouth—it's light on the tongue yet dense and long-lasting.
title: Borgo Conventi 2007 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Round and floral, with melon and other simple, clean aromas. Good mouthfeel, proper acidity and basic, likable flavors of citrus, green apple, green banana and tropical fruits make it a good quaffer and a good value.
title: Callia 2010 Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: This big bottle of Pinot Grigio has strong aromas of peach and is pretty full in flavor though not in finish. Not a lot of acidity here, but the wine is fine for the price and volume. No problem next to a plate of spicy paella.
title: Glen Ellen 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This makes a nice choice for your house white wine to buy by the case. Attractively rich, it seems to be all about the fruit flavor. It brings ripe pear and peach notes, an opulent texture and lingering fruity finish. It is medium-bodied, smooth and complete.
title: Twisted 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a pristine albeit easy wine with clean and compact aromas of stone fruit, yellow flower and zesty citrus. Genuine and aromatic, this is textbook Pinot Grigio with pleasing creaminess on the palate. Pair with pasta salad, grilled white meats and finger foods.
title: Mezzacorona 2006 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This informal white offers aromas of citrus blossom and peach while the light, simple palate shows pear, a touch of lime and a hint of mineral. Zesty acidity leaves a fresh finish.
title: Cesari 2014 Duetorri Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This fresh, informal white opens with subdued aromas of yellow flower and white orchard fruit. The lean, simple palate offers unripe pear, apple skin and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.
title: Ileana 2014 Low Carb Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This deeply yellow-gold coloured wine opens with mature aromas of nut, flint and dried apricot. The lean palate is also already evolved, offering smoky mineral and yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity.
title: SalvaTerra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Intense but rather muddled aromas of Stargazer lily and air freshener lead the nose along with brief dashes of hay, mature peach and apple. The unusual flowery aroma carries through and dominates the lean palate.
title: Torre Rosazza 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Aromas of almond, pressed white flower and crushed stone emerge on this racy white. The palate is less expressive, showing apple skin, mineral and a hint of citrus. It's on the lean side, with brisk acidity.
title: Zorzon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This is an attractive value-driven wine, with fleshy aromas of stone fruit and melon backed by aromatic notes of honey and wild flower. The wine delivers a smooth, rich mouthfeel.
title: Bortoluzzi 2010 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Bold and structured, this is fragrant of yellow rose, stone fruit and honeydew. The wine's creamy finish delivers a bold, chewy softness.
title: Cantarutti 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This nicely structured Pinot Grigio shows a "ramato" or copper color and slightly oxidized aromas of butterscotch, bitter almond and ripe melon. The structure is bigger and more defined than a standard Italian white.
title: Le Vigne di Zamò 2010 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: This is the perfect wine to pair with seafood salad or grilled Ahi tuna steaks. This bright effort shows creamy smoothness, with rich highlights of melon, exotic fruit and honeydew.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2010 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This vineyard-designate Pinot Grigio is nicely executed, with aromas of creamy vanilla, apricot and melon. There's a fragrant touch of yellow rose and even a note of exotic spice that fills in the finish.
title: Fantinel 2010 Vigneti Sant'Helena Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Modest aromas of cut grass, white flower and citrus establish this as an easy-drinking white. The finish is marked with a touch of green lime. It should pair well with shrimp cocktail or basil pesto.
title: Bosco del Merlo 2011 Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

description: Redolent of fresh citrus, peach, pear and fragrant white flower, this is a wine to drink on a hot summer day by the pool.
title: Canaletto 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Structured and sophisticated, it offers creamy green apple, pear, citrus and white peach sensations. The juicy fruit palate is restrained by subtle notes of white pepper and mineral alongside fresh acidity that leaves a focused, lingering finish.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2012 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: A little sweet and simple in pineapple and peach jam flavors, but adequately balanced with acidity. A good white wine for parties.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Simple and sweet, with candied lemon, lime, orange and vanilla flavors. But it's crisp in balancing acidity. At this price, a good cocktail sipper.
title: Murphy-Goode 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: With much more personality than past vintages, the wine's aromas include banana, yellow flower, peach and spice. There's good dimension and personality to this crisp, friendly white that would pair well with vegetables, fish and white meat.
title: Tiamo 2005 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Savory and satisfying, this is one of the best Pinot Grigios at this price point. It shows real class, with brisk acidity framing flavors of lemons, limes, mangoes and honey. Perfect for drinking with today's Asian, Indian, Ethiopian and Mexican fare, or on its own as an apéritif.
title: Oak Grove 2011 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Tasty flavors like Pippin apple and tangy cherry, plus a smooth and lively texture bring a lot of appeal to this light-bodied wine. The combination of crisp acidity, luxurious mouthfeel and bright but subtle flavors is a winning one.
title: Angel's Cup 2013 Vineyard Selection Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The wine is almost salmon in hue, but don't let that put you off. Layers of ground cinnamon help provide balance to the broad, ripe flavors of melon, pear and stone fruit.
title: Brancott 2014 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

description: Round and fruity, it has flavors of ripe Bartlett pear, creamy green apple, white peach and apricot. It's perfect to pour as an apéritif or pair it with starters and light first courses.
title: La Vis 2013 Ritratti Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Straightforward and enjoyable, it delivers aromas of peach blossom and citrus. The juicy palate offers white peach, green apple and banana peel. Sip this as an apéritif or pair with light first courses.
title: Cormòns 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Subdued florals and apple scents have a slightly dusty, chemical edge on the nose of Mazza's Reserve Pinot Grigio. Slight in body but it finishes briskly on the palate. Drink now.
title: Mazza Chautauqua Cellars 2010 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: Plump aromas of melon and almond candy announce a chunky palate with citric acidity. Pithy orange and melon flavors are straightforward, with some sweetness. Consider this a decent, generic white wine.
title: Morandé 2012 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Casablanca Valley)

description: This Pinot Grigio is okay for common purposes, but it's a pretty dull wine. It's on the border between dry and off-dry, and soft in texture, with sugary citrus fruit and herb flavors.
title: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Lively lemon and herb aromas and bright, vivid grapefruit flavors make this an eye-opening dry wine. It has plenty of good fruit acidity to whet the appetite for appetizers and seafood.
title: Geyser Peak 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here again the Grand Estates bottling shows a softer, gentler side of the fruit; the acids seem to have been smoothed over. The fruit is ripe and clean, suggesting white peaches and green apples, but there isn't much depth to it.
title: Columbia Crest 2006 Grand Estates Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a sophisticated and toasted expression of Pinot Grigio that offers thick tones of exotic fruit, apricot, butter, almond and butterscotch. The mouthfeel is creamy, soft and beautifully intense.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2010 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This rich Pinot Grigio sees some contact with oak barrel for a fuller, more generous mouthfeel. Aromas include honey, white almond, lemon zest and stone fruit.
title: Maso Poli 2010 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Golden honey in color, the Ramspeck Sassolini is lush with lemon flavor and high acidity that lingers on the palate, crisp and tart. Sourced from Lake County fruit, a fine place for crisp whites, this wine is balanced in alcohol and richness too.
title: Ramspeck 2010 Sassolini Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

description: There's a distinctive aromatic quality to this wine that comes off more as flowers than it does as fruit. The wine is crisp and satisfying in the mouth and it delivers a touch of piquant spice on the close. This estate was founded more than 400 years ago in 1607.
title: Albino Armani 2007 Corvara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Tastes like unsugared lemonade, with a splash of pineapple and cherry concentrate. Crisply acidic, it's bone dry. Clean and easy, a nice cocktail wine.
title: McManis 2008 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Citrus blossom and orchard fruit aromas lead the way. On the round, medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity supports ripe yellow apple and pear flavors. A hint of citrus zest marks the close.
title: Castello di Spessa 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This structured, copper-colored wine—the natural color of Pinot Grigio after skin contact—delivers dried red berry, nut, lightly toasted oak, butterscotch, vanilla and mineral sensations. It's an unusual but attractive interpretation of Pinot Grigio.
title: Vie di Romans 2012 Dessimis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: From a Lovall Valley location, this light white is intense in pear and peach, with a nuttiness to the strong, viscous foundation of oak. It finishes crisply like a twist of lime.
title: Muscardini 2014 Ansa di Loval Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Napa County)

description: Lemon zest, citrus blossoms and peach aromas lead the way to tropical fruit flavors in this Romanian Pinot Grigio. It is light bodied with a crisp finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: A wonderful appetizer wine, dry, clean and zesty in acidity, with appealing citrus, apple, lemongrass, vanilla and honeysuckle flavors. A great restaurant by-the-glass sipper. Production was 136,000 cases.
title: Turning Leaf 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This luminous, golden Pinot Grigio offers loads of intensity in the form of peach, apricot, honeydew melon and white almond. The mouthfeel is smooth and thick, making this wine particularly well suited to sophisticated pasta dishes such as pumpkin-filled ravioli with crushed walnuts.
title: Valter Scarbolo 2008 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This is a lovely Pinot Grigio “ramato” (with a copperish color) that shows strong aromas of white cherry, cranberry and pink rose. It's smooth and creamy in the mouth and although the alcohol is high, it is well integrated.
title: Valter Scarbolo 2008 XL Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Here's a very successful and aromatic Pinot Grigio from cool-climate Trentino in northern Italy. A small percentage of the grapes undergo air-drying (appassimento) for extra heft and richness on the finish. Aromas include apricot, tropical fruit and a touch of white almond.
title: Maso Canali 2009 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Livio Felluga's Pinot Grigio is distinguished by a thick, creamy mouthfeel and abundant aromas of peach, wild flower and vanilla cream. The wine is clean and pristine, yet structured and smooth at the same time. Very nice.
title: Livio Felluga 2009 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Surprising density and smoothness characterizes this structured Pinot Grigio. The wine is redolent of peach, melon and mature grapefruit with a touch of nutty almond on the close.
title: Marco Felluga 2009 Mongris Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Richer and riper than the '06, this wine shows why Pinot Grigio is such a hit in America, especially at this price. The wine is crisp and savory in acids, with a wealth of citrus, fig, green apple, honeydew melon and vanilla flavors that have an off-dry sweetness.
title: Redtree 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Appley and fresh with hints of white peach and blossoms on the nose and palate, this is a straightforward yet well-made Pinot Grigio that's hard to resist for under $10. Snappy and clean with brisk acidity and a pretty green floral finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2009 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

description: The aromatic delivery is bright, fresh and pristine. Bright acidity is backed by flavors of stone fruit, citrus and Golden Delicious apple. It's the kind of white to serve with summer salad lunches by the pool.
title: La Vis 2010 Intaglio Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Here's a standard, well-made Pinot Grigio that shows bright aromas of citrus, apple, pear and honey. It is defined by a sharp, crisp vein of acidity on the finish.
title: Livon 2011 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Exceedingly fresh and fragrant, this has medium structure, with bright stone fruit and citrus aromas. It should pair with smoked salmon or tuna tartare.
title: Tramin 2011 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Beautiful mountain aromatics of wild flower and Granny Smith apple give this wine a youthful and superfresh personality. The finish is smooth, silky and polished.
title: Girlan 2011 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is a bright, textbook Pinot Grigio that shows the very best of easy-drinking Italian white wine. Light fragrances of sweet nectarine and honey are followed by a palate with medium structure and crisp acidity.
title: Altanuta 2011 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Good for simple everyday drinking, this wine is slightly sweet but crisp with delicate citrus, peach, vanilla and honey flavors.
title: The Loyal Companion 2012 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Le Rime is made as both a Chardonnay-Pinot Grigio blend and as a pure expression of Pinot Grigio for the U.S. market. Easy and fresh, this wine has touches of pear and citrus.
title: Banfi 2011 Le Rime Pinot Grigio (Toscana)

description: Bressan proves that Pinot Grigio can obtain sky high levels of sophistication. This saturated, almost amber-colored wine is rich with opulent honey, apricot, maple syrup, baked pear and pungent pinesap. It's extremely rich, long-lasting and sports a complex, almost prickly personality.
title: Bressan 2004 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Yellow wildflower and peach aromas follow through to the fresh, linear palate along with a nectarine note. It's zesty and balanced, with crisp acidity.
title: Franz Haas 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit and whiff of spring blossom lead the nose on this light, refreshing white. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, the palate is rather lean but still offers pear, apple and a hint of mineral alongside a backbone of bracing acidity.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: The nose opens with aromas of white spring flower and green Anjou pear. The lively, straightforward palate offers crunchy green apple and lime zest alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Cembra 2014 Classici Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: White flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas delicately guide the nose. The easygoing palate offers Bartlett pear, apple skin and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
title: La Tunella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: This bright wine has aromas that suggest citrus blossom and tropical fruit. The lively, slender palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple and pineapple accompanied by brisk acidity.
title: Dorigo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: This is a simple, one-dimensional Pinot Grigio that drinks easily and would pair with salads or grilled tuna. The wine is redolent of citrus, green apple and a touch of white almond.
title: Caldora Vini 2010 Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

description: This is a fresh and friendly white with a floral nose and crisp flavors of pear and lemon. Overall, the wine has body and a dry, elegant character. Pair with seafood or Asian cuisine.
title: Goose Watch 2007 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: here too many Pinot Grigios are sweet and sugary, this one's dry, and it has a crisp acidity that makes the mouth water. The flavors are of ripe Meyer lemons, limes, minerals, honeysuckle flowers and vanilla. Great with Asian-fusion fare.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: White spring flower, ripe pear and grilled herb aromas take center stage in this medium-bodied white. The bright, linear palate offers green apple and citrus flavors, with a hint of clove.
title: Russiz Superiore 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Hay, pressed yellow flower and hazelnut aromas lead the nose in this deeply hued wine. The nutty note carries over to the evolved palate, with fennel and candied citrus zest flavors. It still boasts fresh acidity despite its age, but drink now to enjoy the remaining fruit.
title: Toros 2010 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: There's a touch of lemon soda or lollipop at the start that is soon rounded off by fresher aromas of peach and grapefruit. This is a simple, easy-drinking effort.
title: Antica Corte 2010 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: With just the tiniest amount of residual sugar, this wine presents as thick and heavy on the palate. A woody, herbal, nutty tone underplays fruitier aspects of peach and pear.
title: Benessere 2015 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine is loaded with sensations of fragrant white flowers, ripe tropical fruit, juicy yellow peach and tart green apple. The creamy palate is brightened by fresh acidity and energizing mineral notes. It's well balanced, with more depth than most other Pinot Grigios.
title: St. Pauls 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: There's the ever-so-slight touch of pink to the glass in this bottling by Bruno D'Alfonso, who packs strong and fresh aromas of cider apples, chalk, tangerine zest, pear flesh and light jasmine on the nose. There is tons of energy on the palate, tightening up before unleashing poached Asian pear, lime spritzer and red apple flavors.
title: Di Bruno 2016 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sugary and sweet, this bottling has tangerine, pear and vanilla flavors. For the price, it's a good party wine.
title: Seven Daughters NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a heavy, soft, jammy wine that's sweet in raspberry- and strawberry-jam flavors.
title: Butterfly Kiss 2011 Pink Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Aromas suggesting damp earth and crushed gravel lead the nose while the extremely diluted, short palate shows the barest hint of lemon juice. This is about as basic as a wine can be.
title: La Bellanotte 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This wine is frankly old and downsliding, with aromas of pumpkin and corn flakes. A gold color and mildly oxidized apple-like flavors are tired.
title: Inacayal 2015 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This Pinot Grigio offers aromas of fragrant white flower and citrus zest. Its linear, elegant palate shows tangerine, pear, lemon drop and a hint of crystallized ginger alongside bright acidity.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

description: A popular and well-distributed Pinot Grigio, this opens with fresh aromas of citrus, cut grass and stone fruit. The mouthfeel is generous, rich and fresh.
title: Cavit 2011 Bottega Vinaia Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This easy opens with good structure, a silky mouthfeel and abundant aromas of stone fruit and citrus.
title: Risata 2010 Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

description: Irresistibly fresh and crisp, this hasbright aromas of lemon-lime, green apple and dried hay. Pair this with raw fish, sushi or swordfish carpaccio.
title: Santi 2010 Sortesele Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Lean and easy, this has bright peach, apricot and lemon-lime aromas. A bright note of tangerine skin appears on the finish.
title: Conte Brandolini 2010 D'Adda Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This simple white offers delicate hints of pear and citrus while vibrant acidity gives it a crisp, short finish. It's a quaffing wine to pour at picnics and other informal get-togethers.
title: Tesoro della Regina 2014 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

description: Nobody ever said Argentina was Pinot Grigio country. This wine is yellow in color, with aromas of haystack and wheat. There's acidity to keep it upright, but flavors of briny citrus do little to bring it around.
title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2012 Lote 44 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: This opens with fragrant aromas of yellow rose, apricot, butterscotch and spicy vanilla. It has edium density, with a fresh mouthfeel lending this a unique personality.
title: Tenuta di Angoris 2010 Vôs da Vigne Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: The private wine label of consulting enologist Stefano Chioccioli, Altadonna is a relatively new line. This expression is redolent of lemon, lime, green apple and honeydew.
title: Altadonna 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This fresh white should pair with chicken salad or fish tacos. It offers aromas of lemon, pear and honeydew melon. Screwcap.
title: Bollini 2010 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Packaged with a grape cutting tied to the neck of the bottle, this generous wine shows aromas of ripe melon, apricot and tangerine skin. There's a fresh note of sweet honeysuckle on the close.
title: Cescon Italo Storia e Vini 2011 Il Tralcetto Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Apple peels, squeezed lime, rain on cement, jicama and Asian-pear aromas show on the crisp yet rounded nose of this bottling by actress Drew Barrymore. The palate is quite inviting with broad apple flavors, offering just enough texture and acidity to keep all sorts of wine lovers interested.
title: Barrymore 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's a reasonably layered Pinot Grigio that offers a candy-like level of butterscotch and dried fruit over fresh notes of peach and passion fruit. The wine is piquant and edgy in the mouth and ends with a citric blast of acidity.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2007 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Having spent no time in oak, this crisp, clean white is resplendent in lemon curd and vanilla, joined midway by additional layers of just-picked peach. Medium bodied, with the right texture to hold up to a range of spicy foods, it offers a vibrantly lively finish.
title: Swanson 2014 Pinot Grigio (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Soft, dry and simple, with modest peach, pineapple, lemon and vanilla flavors. Drink now.
title: Luna 2008 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This is a very successful (from packaging to content) expression of Pinot Grigio from cool-climate northern Italy that offers pretty aromas of honey, peach and citrus. It tastes full and creamy on the close but also delivers refreshing crispness at the end.
title: Erste Neue 2009 Grauer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Bright aromas of Granny Smith apple, green fruit, melon and honey emerge from the nose of this fragrant expression of Pinot Grigio. It is creamy and textured in the mouth with a touch of smooth almond paste on the close.
title: Niedermayr Josef 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is an extroverted version of a varietal that can be quite subtle. Aromas suggest grapefruit and pears, while flavors are assertive and citruslike, with an earthy accent. The feel in the mouth is reasonably crisp.
title: Heartache 2012 Passionate Squeeze Pinot Grigio (California)

description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. The lean, rather evolved palate still retains fresh acidity, but drink soon to capture the remaining yellow apple and lemon peel flavors.
title: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Grappoli Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: The aromas are barely a whisper, with notes of citrus and herb. It drinks dry with lightly concentrated fruit flavors. The variety seems hard to find.
title: Hogue 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A mild, softly fruity wine, with unusual grace notes of sandalwood and incense. The fruit suggests cinnamon-sprinkled pears, and the acidity has been cut and softened. A little bit of a plastic, Band-Aid flavor infuses the finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2009 Two Vines Pinot Grigio (Washington)

description: A wonderful, concentrated, lightly spicy wine from the Schiopetto family, with rich flavors of honey and almonds. It has power, but also elegance.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2001 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This tremendous wine is 100% Pinot Grigio, of which 50% was aged in new wood. It is rich and full-bodied, with complex layers of vanilla. It comes from low-yielding, old vines. Only 8,000 bottles were produced.
title: Volpe Pasini 2001 Ipso Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

description: Here's a watery and thinly extracted Pinot Grigio that delivers measured aromas of citrus, honey and passion fruit. This is the kind of easygoing wine you'll want to share at park picnics.
title: Don Giovanni 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Neutral in the extreme, this is an easy pick for a large crowd. It's light on its feet and quite crisp with an over-arching theme of nuts and just a faint hint of citrus. Drink up.
title: Mount Langi Ghiran 2008 Billi Billi Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: A zippy, lively version, this light-bodied wine smells and tastes like a combo of grapefruit, lemon and peach juices, having a crisp character on first sip, and a rich softness on the second.
title: Twisted 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Ripe and forward with Meyer lemon, lime, green apple and honeysuckle flavors. The finish is off dry and zesty in acidity. What an easy wine to drink with Asian, Ethiopian, Indian or Mexican fare, or by itself as a cocktail sipper.
title: Terlato 2011 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

description: Upon pouring, there's a slight haze of CO2 visible in the glass—but that's a good thing in this case, because the unreleased fermentation gasses help enliven the otherwise fat mouthfeel. With aromas of pears and fresh parsley and flavors of pears and pineapple, it's pretty standard stuff, but executed well.
title: Villa Russiz 2001 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: An extremely floral and fragrant expression of Pinot Grigio, with notes of white flower, jasmine and peach blossom. Touches of bitter almond and tangy spice mark the close.
title: Marco Cecchini 2010 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: This is a wonderfully dry, crisp and super-drinkable white wine, perfect for a first cocktail of the afternoon. It's clean and brisk in acidity, with a flourish of lemon, lime and vanilla flavors. Spicy, too. Great with little puff pastry appetizers.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This light-bodied, dry wine smells fresh and fruity, tastes like crisp apples and honeydew melon, and has a soft texture that makes it easy to sip.
title: Bota Box 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: One of the few bubbling Pinot Grigios available in California, there's enough promise here to wonder why not more. Pink grapefruit, ripe peach, kiwi and Gravenstein apple aromas show on the nose, while the palate picks up light apple cider, lime juice and jasmine flavors.
title: South Coast NV Sparkling Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

description: This is a fruity, tropical rendition of grape, showing guava, papaya, coconut and apple aromas on the nose. The palate packs loads of floral character, with more tropical fruit and bubblegum-like flavors that feel ripe but not sweet.
title: Robert Renzoni 2016 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

description: Delicately redolent of pear, melon and stone fruit, this is a fresh and direct Pinot Grigio that leaves a nice trail of zest over the palate. This wine also has nice consistency and structure that is immediately recognized by the thicker trails of glycerin it leaves on the glass: It offers full fruit flavors and bright acidity on the close.
title: Masottina 2006 Ai Palazzi Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: Here's a Pinot Grigio that fulfills the variety's basic responsibilities of dryness, crispness and a clean mouthfeel. It's a drily brisk, racy wine, with suggestions of ripe pink grapefruit, lemongrass and honeysuckle.
title: Oak Grove 2007 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Notes of sun-dried hay and green flower highlight the nose and palate of this fresh, easy-quaffing wine. Concentrated tangerine and pineapple flavors are brisk and tasty.
title: Cramele Recas 2011 UnWineD Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

description: A straightforward, subtle version of Pinot Grigio, light in alcohol, a good choice as an apéritif or as an accompaniment to a light lunch. A lean lemon quality dominates its flavors and aromas.
title: Sorelle Winery 2010 Grazia Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Here's a steady value wine from Northern Italy that shows easy aromas of citrus and melon backed by fresh acidity and a lively mouthfeel. Pair this wine with raw mozzarella drizzled with olive oil.
title: My Moon 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Made the way Pinot Grigio should be. Bone dry and zesty in acidity, it has citrus, mineral and floral flavors that finish with a scour of peppery spice. A brilliant cocktail sipper that will also complement savory appetizers.
title: Longoria 2009 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

description: Partly fermented in oak casks, this linear white offers aromas of white flower, pear, crushed rock and a delicate whiff of oak-driven spice. The elegant palate offers creamy yellow apple, vanilla and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
title: Alois Lageder 2014 Porer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Lovely scents of orchard fruit and apple blossom take center stage. The vibrant, savory palate offers crunchy rennet apple, tangerine and mineral while zesty acidity leads to the tangy finish.
title: Caldaro 2014 Söll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Aromas of Alpine wildflower and peach blossom unfold on this refined mountain white. The balanced palate offers Anjou pear, yellow apple, mineral, tangerine and white almond coupled with crisp acidity.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Attractive aromas that suggest apple, tropical fruit and citrus lift from the glass while the vibrant, elegant palate delivers Bosc pear and mineral. Crisp acidity lifts the silky flavors.
title: Jermann 2014 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Here is an easygoing and fresh Pinot Grigio with light aromas of citrus, chopped herbs and white stone. The mouthfeel is lean but firm and the wine would pair well with stir-fry vegetables.
title: Mezzacorona 2006 Castel Firmian Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: The vineyard is the source of often very great wines along the Central Coast. It's a cool place, in sight of the Pacific, that in this case ripened the grapes perfectly while preserving vital acidity. That makes the citrus, fig and spicy vanilla flavors finish brilliantly clean and vibrant.
title: Perbacco Cellars 2006 Laetitia Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Zesty aromas of stone fruit and fresh citrus characterize the pretty nose of this easy-drinking Pinot Grigio. There's a touch of creaminess in the mouth that would pair with chicken curry or spicy Thai rolls.
title: Guerra Albano 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This does not offer much in terms of aromas other than measured tones of stone fruit and shadings of white mineral. It is equally as easy and informal in the mouth.
title: Vino dei Fratelli 2007 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: The nose is colored by some peach and white mineral that make up a simple but correct wine that gets the job done. The wine is lean, neutral and watery in the mouth.
title: Zonin 2007 Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: A light, lemony, refreshing quaff. Zippy, citrusy and clean, with a tart, malic finish, this is made to whet your summertime appetite.
title: Campanile 2002 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This is an elegant, smooth wine with fresh clean fruit aromas. It has crispness, concentration and just a hint of spice.
title: Elena Walch 2002 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Smells lemony, making you brace for a lean mouthful of tart fruit. But the flavors are riper, offering pear as well as citrus, and the finish actually ends up slightly soft.
title: Plozner 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Exotic and enticing at first, with penetrating lime, muskmelon and floral aromas. Flavors of melon and tropical fruit are simpler. A good bet for outdoor dining, thanks to its standout nose.
title: Tenuta Setten 2001 Vigneto S. Antonio Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: A rich, complex style, with good concentration. There is some spice, along with citrus acidity and softness. It is immediately attractive, but also has pretensions to a more serious depth of flavor.
title: Mezzacorona 2001 Millesimato Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Structured but elegant, it discloses delicate aromas of Spanish broom and Granny Smith apple. The savory, creamy palate delivers juicy Bartlett pear, citrus, nectarine and melon brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: From grapes grown in the high altitude Castel Ringberg vineyard, Elena Walch delivers a vibrant, balanced wine that shows structure and finesse. It's loaded with sensations of Granny Smith apple, lemon zest, banana peel and an underlying mineral note that carries to the crisp finish.
title: Elena Walch 2012 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Hushed aromas of white flower and Bartlett pear come together on this refreshing white. On the palate, lively acidity carries tangerine zest, green apple and peach nectar.
title: Klaus Lentsch 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Pear, honeydew melon and floral note lift from the glass. The bright, no-frills palate offers up crisp apple and citrus peel while lively acidity provides a tangy finish.
title: Kupel Wieser 2014 Alfio Moriconi Selection Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This has a slightly copper hue and is delicately scented with aromas of hawthorn and orchard fruit. Its racy palate shows subtle notes of tangerine zest, lime and a hint of apple while a mineral note marks the finish.
title: Primosic 2014 Poderi di Carlo Gmajne Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: White blossom and apple aromas open on this vibrant white while the racy palate shows Kaiser pear, tangerine and a hint of mineral. Zesty acidity gives it a clean, crisp finish.
title: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Penguin Bay has managed to coax some fruit out of the reticent Pinot Grigio grape: this example has nice pineapple and melon tones upfront. It's less impressive in the mouth, with significant residual sugar and a short, watery finish. Drink up.
title: Penguin Bay 2008 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine has light citrus aromas and flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and yellow peach. Pleasant fruit sweetness marks the finish.
title: Jidvei 2015 Demi-Sec Pinot Grigio (Jidvei)

description: This opens with subdued aromas that evoke dried yellow flower and overripe citrus peel. The aromas carry over to the lean brisk palate along with suggestions of lemon, bitter yellow-apple skin and an unusual funky hint of crushed black olive.
title: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This opens with subdued, mature yellow apple, acacia and almond aromas that carry over to the abrupt, tangerine-inflected palate. It has a lean, bitter finish.
title: La Rajade 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Neutral and luminous with candy-like notes of butterscotch and caramel, this fresh Pinot Grigio follows through with stone fruit and ripe grapefruit. Lemon meringue pie and peach cream appear on the chewy finish.
title: Maso Poli 2007 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This refreshing Pinot Grigio has all its cards in place and offers pretty aromas of peach, Golden Delicious apple, honey and green melon. It tastes fresh and has sweet tones of yellow fruit and honey.
title: La di Motte 2007 Pinot Grigio (Piave)

description: There's a really nice point of mature peach or apricot that emerges from the fragrant bouquet of this luminous and bright Pinot Grigio. That fruity note adds a sweet sensation to the nose followed by aromas of passion fruit and citrus.
title: Tommasi 2010 Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Good price for this dry, crisp and stylish Pinot Grigio. Easy to drink as a cocktail sipper, with lemon and lime sour candy flavors that sweeten toward the end with a hit of honey.
title: Smoking Loon 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a very interesting Pinot Grigio with a unique aromatic profile that includes a green note of chopped herbs or crushed white pepper. There are pretty fruit notes too and the wine is silky and crisp on the close.
title: Vigneti Villabella 2009 Vigna di Pesina Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: There's a natural creaminess to this wine that helps elevate aromas of peach nectar, apricot and honey. The mouthfeel is smooth and silky and imparts lasting citrus notes on the close.
title: Volpe Pasini 2008 Grivò Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: The quality-price ratio here is simply unbeatable. Mezzacorona presents a fuller, rounder, more satisfying Pinot Grigio with ripe aromas of peach, pear and honey. There's a smooth, creamy feel in the mouth.
title: Mezzacorona 2009 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Lively lemon and herb aromas and bright, vivid grapefruit flavors make this an eye-opening dry wine. It has plenty of good fruit acidity to whet the appetite for appetizers and seafood.
title: Geyser Peak 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Hints of honeycomb and beeswax add heft to the notes of fresh green flower and sweet citrus. Ripe yet elegantly composed, this has concentrated fruit flavors that extend onto a long, honeysuckle-kissed finish.
title: Penguin Bay 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)
